loans.name: Women Of Peace Group

texts.en:
Alberteen K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Women Of Peace." She is 50 years old and married, with eight children who range from 16 to 32 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade.

For five years, she has been selling drinks and soap in New Georgia Estate Market, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She started her business with 75 United States dollars her aunt gave her.

She plans to use her 5,000-Liberian-dollar portion of this 25,000-Liberian-dollar group loan to buy more drinks and soap.

Her dream is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and soap

loans.name: Rufine

texts.fr: A. Rufine est née le 01 Décembre 1959 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Mariée à DANGBENON Gérard, un maçon, Rufine est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Il y a près de vingt ans que Rufine s'est installée au quartier Dodomey à Allada, où elle y vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Rufine n'a jamais été à l'école. Depuis une douzaine d'année, Rufine mène comme activité la vente de tissus à Allada, par le système de distribution, ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans difficulté à ses besoins et de se faire une épargne. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin que Rufine achète ses produits. Rufine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Dans l'optique d'augmenter davantage le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle, Rufine sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Rufine A. was born December 1, 1959 in Allada, in the department of the Atlantic. Married to Gerard DANGBENON, a mason, Rufine is the mother of two children, one of them attends school. Nearly twenty years ago Rufine moved to the neighborhood of Dodomey Allada, where she lives with her children and husband. The couple provides together for the family expenses. Rufine has never been at school. For a dozen years, Rufine has been selling textiles in Allada, through a distribution system, which allows her to provide for her needs and make savings. Rufine buys her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rufine has received two loans from ALIDé and they have been fully repaid. In order to further increase the stock of her products and better meet the growing demand of her customers, Rufine is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of textiles

loans.name: Aminata C.

texts.en:
Pictured above is Aminata C. S., an entrepreneur in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Aminata has applied for a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to keep expanding her business. In her stall, right at the center of town, Aminata sells market foodstuffs like rice, beans, flour, sugar, oil, bulgur wheat, pepper, etc. 

Aminata has been doing business for more than fifteen years now. With the help of her previous SMT/Kiva lenders' loan, Aminata has realized a vast improvement in her business and personal life. With the help of this new loan, she will buy the above-mentioned goods wholesale to further expand her business.

loans.use: Buy market foodstuffs like rice, beans, flour, sugar, oil, bulgur wheat, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal out of her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Paulina is 39 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hawa Group

texts.en:
Hawa J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Hawa Group." She is 52 years old and married, with five children who range from 20 to 35 years old. She did not have the privilege of attending school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school.

For 30 years, she has been selling tomatoes, salt, peanuts, and cooking oil at the Freeport Market in Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 15,000-Liberian-dollar portion of this 46,000-Liberian-dollar group loan to buy more tomatoes, salt, peanuts, and cooking oil.

Her dream is to grow her business, build a store, and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, salt, peanuts, and cooking oil

loans.name: Pheobe

texts.en:
Pheobe J. is currently in the business of selling bread, tomatoes and groundnut (peanut) paste and is requesting a loan to stock fish to sell.  Pheobe is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is a clerk. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a real shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock fish to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson T. is from the village of Kabayan, Kadingilan Bukidnon. He is 47 years old. Samson is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Samson owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Samson has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Samson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Samson is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Samson from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: This lady is 37 years old. She works at a business selling beauty products. Her husband works doing painting and touch-ups of automobiles. They have three children. She sells her products by loading them onto her head and distributing them throughout the streets. She's worked at this business since 2002. Now she has requested her first loan from WAGES of 200,000 CFA in order to purchase various products such as cosmetics, nail polish, and fake nails.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Benoît

texts.fr: E. Benoît est né en 1969 à Dogbo au Bénin. Marié à BOKONON Emilienne, une revendeuse, Benoît est père de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et encore à sa charge. Benoît s'est installé depuis vingt deux ans environs au quartier Dodji Dangban à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique, avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Benoît a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, puis a commencé à vendre des pièces de rechange à Békon, à Allada. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Benoît s'approvisionne. Benoît exerce cette activité depuis vingt deux ans, et a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'il a bien remboursé. Benoît voudrait élever le niveau de son activité et mieux assurer la demande de sa clientèle, sans connaître de rupture de stock. C'est ce qui l'a conduit à solliciter un nouveau concours financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
E. Benoît was born in 1969 in Dogbo in Bénin. Married to BOKONON Emilienne, a petty trader, Benoît is the father of five children who are all enrolled in school and still being supported by him. About 22 years ago, Benoît came to live in the Dodji Dangban district of Allada, in the Atlantique province, with his wife and children. The couple share in supporting their family. Benoît stopped going to school at the secondary level, then began to sell spare parts at Békon, in Allada. He buys his inventory in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Benoît has been in this business for 22 years and has already received one loan from ALIDé, which he has correctly reimbursed. He would like to expand his business and better satisfy his clientele by not experiencing shortages of this or that part. This has led him to request a new loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of spare parts

loans.name: The United Brothers Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “United Brothers” group. They are small-scale businessmen in Waterloo, a small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They have applied for a loan of SLL 4,000,000 for the entire group from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve.
 
Steven M. (left) is the leader of this group. Steven was born in Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. He is thirty-three years of age, married with no children. Steven sells spare parts for both motorbikes and vehicles. He has been selling spare parts for twelve years now. With his share of the loan (SLL 1,500,000) he will buy general spare parts to add to his shop inventory.

loans.use: Buy spare parts to add to his shop inventory

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Kiorob, Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 20th loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more drugs for his pharmacy

loans.name: Badoussi

texts.fr: Née en Janvier 1960 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique, A. Badoussi est une veuve ayant à sa charge deux enfants, tous scolarisés et qui sont ses enfants. Badoussi vit donc seule avec ses enfants au quartier Ahito à Allada, depuis quatre ans. C'est Badoussi seule qui s'occupe donc des différentes charges de la famille. Badoussi n'est jamais allée à l'école. Pour assurer ses différents besoins, Badoussi mène comme activité la vente de tissus au marché de Allada. Badoussi s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est depuis quatre ans déjà que Badoussi mène cette activité, et Badoussi a obtenu une fois déjà de prêt à ALIDé. La clientèle de Badoussi devient de plus en plus nombreuse. Afin de mieux les satisfaire et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Badoussi sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in January 1960 in Allada, in the Atlantique province, A. Badoussi is a widow raising two children, both enrolled in school and both her biological children. She has been living alone with her children in the Ahito neighborhood in Allada, for four years. She is the sole breadwinner for the family. Badoussi never attended school. To support herself, she sells cloth in the market of Allada. She buys her inventory in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. She has been in this business for four years already and has received one loan from ALIDé. Her clientele has become ever more numerous and so as to satisfy their needs and increase her sales, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 13 lengths of cloth

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia R. is from the village of Old Damulog, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Delia is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a service-based business. Aside from her small variety store where she sells both food and daily use products, the main source of income for the business comes from providing video karaoke services to local community members. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional products to sell in her store. Delia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for her video karaoke business like chairs and tables. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Delia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her video karaoke business

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine P. is from the village of Pinamaloy, Don Carlos Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Cristine is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristine owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Cristine has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cristine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair the shield of her "motorcab," a motorcycle with a cab. Cristine is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service such as tires and interiors. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Cristine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: materials needed to provide service such as tires and interiors

loans.name: Efril

texts.en:
Efril E. is from the village of Kabayan, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Efril is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Efril owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish in the local community. Efril has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Efril joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Efril has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase more fish to sell and as working capital. Efril is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Efril from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La  Sra. Juliana es separada y tiene 2 hijas quienes aún son menores, están cursando la escuela primaria.
Juliana se dedica a la venta en forma ambulante, vende frazadas, sabanas, toallas y un poco de ropas.
Ella se inició hace varios años con muy poca mercadería cuando aún estaba casada  poco a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años.
 Hoy día ella tiene muchas mercaderías y bien surtidos, y ademas pudo abrir un negocio en su casa con una  clientela  bien formada.
Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de un golodinas, panificados, carne para preparar comestibles para la venta.
texts.en:
Juliana is separated and has two minor children in primary school. She is a traveling saleswoman of blankets, sheets, towels, and some clothing. She started several years ago with very little merchandise while she was still married. Little by little she grew her business over the years. Today she is well stocked with lots of merchandise, and she was able to open a business in her house with a well formed clientele. She is a very responsible person with hopes of getting ahead. She has a cheerful, enterprising spirit that will no doubt achieve all her goals. She is soliciting a loan for the purchase of sweets, baked goods, and meat to prepare food to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets, baked goods, meat, sausages

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna J. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Myrna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to pay the laborers for assisting her in harvesting her crops. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her young crops. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her young crops

texts.en:
Jasmin C. is from the village of Macapari, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Jasmin is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Jasmin owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling charcoal and firewood in the local community. Jasmin has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jasmin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jasmin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Jasmin is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase coconut shells for charcoal processing, to be sold subsequently. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jasmin from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Paul

texts.fr: Né en 1971 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique, K. Paul vit depuis trente neuf ans environs au quartier Dodji Ahito à Allada. Paul est marié à YEHOUME Sidonie, une revendeuse, et est père de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Paul a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis cinq, Paul achète des lapins qu'il élève et qu'il vend à Allada et aussi à Cotonou. Paul achète ses lapins à Calavi et à Glo au Bénin. Paul a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'il a bien remboursé et qui lui a permis de renforcer un peu son activité. Dans le but d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Paul sollicite un deuxième prêt. Paul ambitionne contruire une cage supplémentaire pour ses lapins.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Allada, in the Atlantique province, K. Paul has been living for about 39 years in the Dodji Ahito neighborhood of Allada. Paul is married to YEHOUME Sidonie, a petty trader, and he is the father of six children, all in school. The couple share in supporting their family. Paul left off school at the secondary level. For five years, he has been buying and raising rabbits which he sells in Allada and also in Cotonou. He buys his rabbits in Calavi and in Glo in Bénin. Paul has already received one loan from ALIDé, which he correctly reimbursed and which allowed him to expand his business a little. Wishing to expand further and better satisfy his clientele, Paul is requesting a second loan. His ambition is to build another cage for his rabbits.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 10 female rabbits and three sacks of feed

loans.name: La Victoria Y Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de la Sra. Sandra Dávalos, quien se entero del programa por intermedio del Comité   Niño Jesús del Barrio Cptan. Roa, de la Ciudad de Cnel. Oviedo, la misma invitó a sus vecinas para poder conformar y participar del Programa de Comité de Mujeres.
 Ellas son independientes en sus labores asi como la señora Angelica quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles en un casilla frente a su casa ya que esta cerca de una parada de buces donde concurre mucha gente quiene conforman su clientela. Así ella se levanta muy tempreno todos los días para preparar sus comestibles para ofrecer pruductos frescos y así satifacer a sus clientes.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de un mostrados de vidrio con focos, ya que actualmente no cuenta con esta herremienta para mantener sus preparados, y agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya y Kiva por la ayuda que les brinda.
texts.en:
This group was formed by Sandra Dávalos, who entered the program through the captain of the Niño Jesús del Barrio group in the city of Colonel Oviedo. She herself invited her neighbors to form and participate in the Women's Group Program. They work independently. Angelica, for instance, sells food from a stall in front of her house. It is very close to a bus stop where lots of people gather, and they form her clientele. She wakes up very early every morning to prepare the food so she can offer fresh products and satisfy her customers. She is seeking a loan to purchase a display case with lights, as she currently lacks one to display her products. She thanks Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva for the help they have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food, beverages, and ingredients

Cristina B. is from the village of Old Damulog, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Cristina is married and has 5 children. loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lino

texts.es: Lino Salmerón tiene 46 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado. Este no es el primer financiamiento que se le ha otorgado, pues ha demostrado que es una persona responsable y que disfruta de su trabajo. Tiene 4 hijos pero 2 de ellos viven por cuenta propia y 2 están bajo su cuido, empezó su trabajo desde hace 13 años hasta que su esposa le dio la idea de mejorar su actividad, el es una persona muy humilde. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para comprar terneros, vacas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es lograr que sus hijos lleguen a la universidad.
texts.en:
Lino Salmerón, age 46, buys and sells livestock. This is not the first loan that he has had. He has demonstrated that he is a responsible person who enjoys his work. He has four children. Two of them live on their own, and two are under his care. He started this work 13 years ago. His wife gave him the idea of improving his activity. He is a very humble person. The loan he is requesting is for working capital to buy calves and cows among other things. His wish is that his children attend the university.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Faithful Friends Group

texts.en:
Esther T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Faithful Friends. She is 44 years old and widowed, with three children who range from 5 to 24 years old. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to poverty. All of her children are attending school.

For 6 years, she has been selling rice, oil, pepper, and charcoal in Gardnersville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 7,000-Liberian-dollar portion of this 35,000-Liberian-dollar group loan to buy more rice, oil, pepper, and charcoal.

Her goal is to grow her business, build a shop, and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jackson is inset at the lower right because he was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, pepper, and charcoal

loans.name: Logo

texts.fr: Né en 1946 à Allada dans le département de l'Atlantique, D. Logo vit depuis près de soixante ans au quartier Dodji Aliho à Allada. Logo a six enfants, dont seulement deux sont à sa charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Logo vit seul avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges. Logo n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Logo vend à domicile et aussi à Cotonou, des lapins qu'il achète et qu'il élève. Logo achète en effet ses lapins à Calavi et à Glo au Bénin. Logo mène cette activité depuis six ans et a déjà bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Logo désire renforcer son activité et accroître son chiffre d'affaire. Mais compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont il dispose, Logo sollicite un deuxième crédit afin d'augmenter son stock de matières premières.
texts.en:
Born in 1946 in Allada in Atlantique province, D. Logo has been living in the Dodji Aliho neighborhood in Allada for almost 60 years. Logo has six children, of whom only two are still dependent on him. Some of the children are in school. Logo lives alone with his children and supports them. He did not go to school himself. To support himself, he sells, out of his home and in Cotonou, rabbits that he buys and raises. He acquires his rabbits in Calavi and in Glo in Bénin. Logo has been in this business for six years and has already had one loan from ALIDé. He wants to bolster his business and make more sales. However, in view of the meager resources he disposes of, Logo is requesting a second loan to add to his stock of raw materials.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 10 bags of rabbit feed

loans.name: Irma Del Rosario

texts.es: Irma Del Rosario tiene 31años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella comenzó como vendedora una casa comercial por lo que las ventas las realiza por catálogos pues así ofrece a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos. Poco a poco fue incrementando su número de clientela pero con esfuerzo y dedicación ella invitaba a sus amigas para que sean vendedoras. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cremas, perfumes, colonias, lápiz labial, sombras y cremas. Su deseo es seguir con este negocio que con mucho esfuerzo ha tenido.
texts.en:
Irma Del Rosario is 31 years old. She sells cosmetics, and she has been is this business for over five years. She has two minor children under her care. She started as a seller for a commercial house. Her sales are by catalog. That way she offers her customers a variety of products. Little by little the number of her customers was getting larger. With effort and dedication she invited her friends to become sellers. The loan she is requesting is to buy creams, perfumes, colognes, lipsticks, and eye shadow. Her wish is to continue with this business that she has by working hard.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Unidas Para Seguir 1 Group

texts.en:
Celeste is the coordinator of her group, Unidas Para Seguir(United for Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsuL., an area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children.

Celeste is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small cafeteria by purchasing bread, juice, sodas, papayas, cookies and a blender to supply her cafeteria. She will use the profits to invest in her own university education, as well as buying school supplies for her children. She would also like to invest in her home by remodeling it and in her business by finding a permanent location and moving it out of her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase bread, juice, sodas, papayas, cookies and a blender.

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
Oretha D. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "United Women". She is 42 years old, married and has eight children who range in age from 3 to 25 years old. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to financial difficulties. 

For 10 years now, she has been selling rice and oil. She also sews garments for women and children at the Red Light market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She describes herself as hardworking.

Oretha plans to use her 12,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 54,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice, oil and cloth to sew more garments. Her dream is to grow her business and to continue to support her family so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Charles S. is holding the sign and Esther D. is inset at lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil and cloth to sew more garments

loans.name: Believe Usef Group

texts.en: Zainab K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Zainab was born in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone, about 25 years ago. She is married to a gardener and the couple has two children between the ages of three and nine. For over five years now, Zainab has been selling rice, gari (quick-cooking food made out of cassava roots), sugar, etc. With the help of this loan, Zainab and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Zainab K. will specifically use her share of the loan (SLL 700,000) to expand her business: she will buy rice, gari and sugar wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, gari and sugar wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Faith Women Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Faith Women” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mary S. is the leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a building contractor and they have two children who are one and four. Mary has been a businesswoman for four years now; she sells cooked rice, meat, fish, and vegetables. With her share of this loan, she will buy rice, frying oil, and other cooking ingredients wholesale.

loans.use: Buy rice, frying oil, and other cooking ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Nilda Agustina

texts.es:
Nilda de 41 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran  (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución), Nilda para poder solventar su hogar tuvo que viajar a España para buscar las oportunidades que no tenia en su país, por un periodo de 10 años tuvo que trabajar en España para tener el mismo negocio de deposito de madera de su padre. 

Cuando regreso a Ecuador ella compro madera para su negocio, con la guía de su padre obtuvo buenos resultados, ahora ella trabaja de lunes a sábados comprando y vendiendo madera, tiene todo tipo de madera, caña, tablas, guayacán etc. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar tablas y caña para su deposito de madera. 

En el futuro quiere tener otro deposito de madera para expandirse.
texts.en:
Nilda, age 41, lives in Primavera de Duran (the urban perimeter was originally irregular with various hills, creeks, and lakes that are still there even though they appear as the remains of an ecology in dissolution). To support her household Nilda had to travel to Spain. She was looking for opportunities that she did not have in her country. She had to work in Spain for ten years. This was in order for her to have the same business, a lumberyard, as her father. When she returned to Ecuador she bought wood for her business. With her father’s guidance she got good results. She now works Monday through Saturday buying and selling wood. She has all types of wood; cane, planks, and Guayacan, etc. With the loan she will buy planks and cane for her lumberyard. In the future she wants to have another lumberyard in order to expand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planks and cane

loans.name: Mugomeh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Mugomeh” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are petty businessmen who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,800,000 for the entire group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Ansumana Y.. Ansumana was born in a village called Shengeh, thirty-four years ago. He is married and has three children who are between the ages of one and seven. Ansumana sells used shoes and has been in this business for fifteen years now. With his share of the loan, he will buy a bale of used shoes to add to his business.

loans.use: Buy a bale of used shoes for resale

loans.name: One Word Women Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “One Word Women” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 700,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Adama V. pictured on the left. Adama is age 43, a widow who has three children between the ages of eleven and twenty-three. For many years now, Adama has been selling firewood. With her share of this loan, she will buy piles of firewood and sell them retail.

loans.use: Buy piles of firewood to sell retail

loans.name: We Dee Woman Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will be able to add more stock in their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school and feeding and clothing them. 

Marie D. is the leader of this group. She was born in Waterloo forty-two years ago. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending schools – one in college and three in secondary school. 

Marie sells market food such as palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), vegetable oil, rice, etc. She has been doing this business for more than eleven years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying palm oil, vegetable oil and rice wholesale.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, vegetable oil and rice wholesale

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Pictured above is Ibrahim B., an entrepreneur in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Ibrahim has applied for a loan of SLL 3,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to keep expanding his business. In his shop, right at the center of town, Ibrahim sells cosmetics at one side of the shop and assorted goods such as biscuits, sweets, batteries, cigarettes, etc., on the other side. 

Ibrahim has been doing business for more than nine years now. With the help of a previous SMT/Kiva lenders loan, Ibrahim has realized a vast improvement in his business and personal life. With the help of this new loan, he will buy the above-mentioned goods wholesale to further expand his business.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and assorted goods such as biscuits, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Pola Marqueza

texts.es:
Pola Marqueza B. V. tiene 56 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene una hija, Doris, de 34 años.
Pola es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a 30 minutos del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura. 
Pola trabaja en la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de su familia. Los productos que más siembra son maíz y fréjol. En la casa, Pola se dedica a la costura.  Ella vende sus productos y también realiza sus compras en el mercado de San Miguel.
Pola solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y más productos para la agricultura. Piensa que el préstamo la ayudará a mejorar la condición económica de su familia.  Su meta es mejorar su vivienda, comprar semilla certificada para una mejor producción y para tener mejores precios. Los desafíos que ella enfrenta en la familia es la falta de dinero para comprar insumos y la falta de mano de obra.
Pola dice que las costumbres del cantón son las fiestas del Patrón San Miguel y sus carnavales. Como hobby, le gusta jugar Basket.
texts.en:
Pola Marqueza B. V., 56, is married and lives with her husband in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar province. She has a daughter, Doris, who is 34 years old. Pola is a member of the communal bank "Lotan Bajo," which is located 30 minutes from the town of San Miguel. There are 13 members in all, and the majority of them work in agriculture. Pola works in agriculture to provide a source of income for her family. She cultivates corn and beans. In the house, Pola also does sewing work. She sells her products and also makes her purchases in the San Miguel market. Pola requests a loan to buy fertilizers and other products for agriculture. She thinks that this loan will help her to improve the economic situation of her family. Her goal is to improve their house, and to buy seed that is certified for better production so that she can get better prices for her products. The challenges she faces are the lack of money to buy supplies and a lack of labor. Pola says that the customs of her canton are the fiestas of Patrón San Miguel and their carnivals. As a hobby, she likes to play basketball.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other products for agriculture

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn A. is from the village of Malobalo, Kitaotao Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Analyn is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Analyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling nata de coco (jelly coconut dessert) and orange juice in the local community. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more raw ingredients & additional working capital. This  will be the 2nd loan taken out by Analyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients & towards working capital.

loans.name: Ángel Leonidas

texts.es:
Ángel Leonidas V. S. tiene 75 años de edad. Es casado, y vive con su esposa y nietos: Gonzalo (18 años) y Galo (8 años), en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene una hija, Aida, de 35 años.  
Ángel es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura. 
Ángel se dedica a la agricultura y cultiva maíz, trigo y papas. Hace las compras y ventas en el mercado cada fin de mes. 
Solicita el crédito para trabajar y comprar abonos y urea. Piensa que con los abonos será más fácil. Sus metas para los próximos años es trabajar. Enfrenta enfermedades en la familia.
En su tiempo libre, a Ángel le gusta bailar y cantar.
texts.en:
Ángel Leonidas V. S. is 75 years old. He is married, and lives with his wife and grandchildren. Gonzalo is 18 years old, and Galo is 8 years old. They live in the town of San Miguel in the Bolívar province. He has one daughter, Aida. Aida is 35 years old. Ángel is a member of the Lotan Bajo Communal Bank. It is half an hour from the town of San Miguel. There are 13 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture. Ángel is a farmer, and he grows corn, wheat, and potatoes. He buys and sells in the market every weekend. He is requesting the loan to work and buy fertilizer and urea. He thinks that it will be easier with the fertilizers. His goal for the upcoming years is to work. There are illnesses in his family. In his free time Ángel likes to dance and sing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To work and buy fertilizers and urea

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza P. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Analiza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Analiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more slippers

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth S. is from the village of Old Damulog, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Lilibeth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a video karaoke service to local community members. She also sells beer and soft drinks. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lilibeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Rwensinga Twimukye, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
The produce sales business is very much liked by many entrepreneurs here in Uganda and this is where A. Levi has banked his savings to earn more profit.

The married father of five started up a grocery store dealing in dry foods, especially cereals, ten years ago in Omukafunjo, Ibanda. Due to his hard work and determination, Levi has been able to run this business and it earns him profits of 80,000 Ugandan shillings monthly.

With this loan, Levi is looking forward to restocking his business which will benefit him in the market and also attract many customers to his shop. Earning more revenue and expanding his business is his main motive in this case so as to live a self-sustaining life.

Levi belongs to a group of members who are on their 14th loan.

loans.use: To restock his business

loans.name: Good Samaritan #2 Group

texts.en:
Kumba F. has been selling building materials like zinc, shovels, hacksaws, nails and wheelbarrows at the Red Light market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia, for six years. She started her business with a loan from LEAP. She is 38 years old, widowed and has three children who range in age from 12 to 20 years old. She was not privileged to attend school due to financial difficulties. 

Kumba, who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Good Samaritan #2". She plans to use her 14,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 56,000 LRD group loan to buy more zinc, shovels, hacksaws, nails and wheelbarrows. Her hope is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more zinc, shovels, hacksaws, nails and wheelbarrows

loans.name: Gustavo Hidalgo

texts.es:
Gustavo Hidalgo M. B. tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, y vive con su esposa e hijos, Gustavo (24) y Diego (18), en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Gustavo es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura. 
Gustavo es agricultor y los productos que cultiva son maíz, trigo, habas y arbeja.  Hace las compras y las ventas cada mes en el mercado de San Miguel, cuando se necesita. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos para invertir en la agricultura. Piense que va a ser más fácil con el crédito. Su sueño seria de poder hacer una casita para su familia y crecer más el negocio. 
Le gusta hacer deportes en su tiempo libre: jugar volley y también pasar tiempo con sus hijos
texts.en:
Gustavo Hidalgo M. B. is 50 years old and married. He and his wife have two children, Gustavo (age 24) and Diego (age 18), and live in the canton of San Miguel in Bolivar Province.

Gustavo is a member of the Communal Bank “Lotan Bajo”, which is 30 minutes away from the town of San Miguel. The group has a total of 13 members, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Gustavo is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and peas. He buys and sells each month at the market in San Miguel as needed. Gustavo is requesting a loan to buy compost for his farming activities. He believes the loan will making things easier for him. His dreams include building a house and expanding his business. He enjoys sports in his free time, such as volleyball, and spending time with his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Progreso De Esperanza 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Esperanza is the coordinator of her group Progreso D. Esperanza (Progress of Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsuL.,where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her child.

Esperanza is excited to be taK. her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to uS. this loan to invest in her business running a small "colmado" or general store by purchasing bread, juice, sodas, beans, sugar, rice, and plantains to stock her store. She will uS. the profits to invest in school supplies for her children as well as construction materials for her home. Finally, she would also like to save enough to rent a location for her business so that she can move it out of her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy bread, juice, sodas, beans, sugar, rice, and plantains.

loans.name: Blanca Nube

texts.es:
La señora  Blanca C. es socia del bankito Mujeres de Trabajo ubicado en la ciudad de Azogues o llamada tambien San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues, es la  capital de la provincia del  Cañar que por su ubicación topográfica es una ciudad bien asoleada desde el punto Este en el templo del Santuario Franciscano, además podemos observar grandes inclinaciones hasta el cajón del río Burgay, mientras que en el sentido sur-norte se conforman breves planicies que permitieron el asentamiento y desarrollo del trazo urbano con las respectivas variantes y adaptaciones lo que hace que la ciudad tenga una fisonomía de gran belleza durante las horas de más sol produciendo fuertes contrastes que acentúan los valores de su distribución urbano-arquitectónica.

Nuestra socia se encuentra en su tercer ciclo trabajando con  la fundación  invitada por una amiga que ya no pertenece al bankito, ella es comerciante de billetes de lotería labora de 9 a.m. a 7 p.m.  con ésta actividad ha logrado salir  adelante con su familia.

Blanca tiene 47 años de edad, se separó de su esposo hace dos  años, fruto de su unión concibió un hijo que se encuentra de 10 años y  se encuentra estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá, con sus nuevo crédito invertira en la compra de más billetes de lotería.

Su meta es comprarse un auto.
texts.en:
Blanca C. is a member of the Bankito Mujeres de Trabajo (Working Women Community Bank) located in the town of Azogues (also called San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues), the capital city of the Cañar county. This town enjoys a lot of sunshine, thanks to its geographical position: on the eastern side, from the church of the Franciscan Sanctuary, we can in fact appreciate big slopes descending towards the bed of the Burgay river, while the south-north axis is draped by short planes that have allowed the settlement and development of the urban outline, with relevant paths and adjustments giving the town a beautiful look during daylight hours, and thus creating strong contrasts emphasizing its urban-architectural layout. Blanca is in her third cycle with the foundation: she was introduced to us by a friend that no longer belongs to the bank. She sells lottery tickets, working from 9 am to 7 pm. Through this activity she has succeeded in getting by with her family. Blanca is 47 years old and separated from her husband two years ago. They have a 10-year-old son, studying in a town school. Not having an house of her own, she lives in her mother’s house. She will use this new loan to buy more lottery tickets. Her goal is to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more lottery tickets.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Guadalupe de la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, la zona queda ubicada a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace mas de tres años en la venta de refrescos, ella vende refrescos preparados   con frutas naturales en una pequeña carretilla ambulante ubicada a espaldas de la plaza de armas de la ciudad en donde vive, el negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia por lo que siempre trata de ofrecer productos de calidad y un buen trato a sus clientes.

Carmen desea adquirir mas frutas para seguir adelante con su negocio y también desea incursionar en la venta de sanguches, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es poder seguir trabajando para construir su casa propia, ya que actualmente reside junto a sus suegros. Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y que se esfuerza al máximo para sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 29 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the district of Guadalupe in Pacasmayo Province, La Libertad region. This area is located an hour and ten minutes away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Carmen has been selling refreshments for more than three years. She prepares cold drinks made of natural fruits from a small mobile cart located on the edge of the main city square. Her business has been a great help to her family’s finances. She always offers quality products and good service to her customers.

Carmen wants to acquire more fruit to move her business forward. She also wants to sell sandwiches. In order to achieve this goal, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700 PEN. Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can build her own house because she currently lives with her in-laws. Carmen is a hardworking woman who does all that she can so that her family can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit for preparing soft drinks & ingredients for making sandwiches

loans.name: Mario Bolívar

texts.es:
Mario Bolívar B. V. tiene 59 años de edad y vive con su esposa y 6 hijos, Rodrigo (34), Narciza (30), Mirian (28), Blanca (26), Marlit (24) y Simon (22), en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Mario es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Se dedica a la agricultura como principal fuente de ingresos de su familia. Lo que produce es el maíz, fréjol, papas y legumbres, para consumo de su familia y venta. Ella vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Quito y realiza sus compras en San Miguel.
Mario solicita el préstamo para la agricultura, específicamente para la compra de insumos y pago de jornales. Piensa que el crédito la ayudará a mejorar su condición económica y a mejorar la calidad del producto. Su meta es comprar un terreno para aumentar sus cultivos y también mejorar su casa.  
Los desafíos que ella enfrente son condiciones climáticas que causan enfermedades en los cultivos.
A Mario le gusta pasear con su familia. La costumbre del cantón es el carnaval que se celebra con familiares  y amigos todos los años en el mes de febrero.
texts.en:
Mario Bolívar B. V. is 59 years old. He lives with his wife and their six children; Rodrigo (34), Narciza (30), Mirian (28), Blanca (26), Marlit (24), and Simon (22). They live in the town of San Miguel in the Bolívar province. Mario is a member of the Lotan Bajo Communal Bank. It is a half an hour from the town of San Miguel. There are 13 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture. Agriculture is the primary source of income for his family. He produces corn, kidney beans, and vegetables for family consumption and to sell. He sells his products at the wholesale market in Quito. He makes his purchases in San Miguel. Mario is requesting a loan for farming. Specifically, he will buy supplies and pay wages. He believes that the loan will help him improve his economic situation and improve the quality of his products. His goal is to buy a piece of land to increase his crops. He also wants to improve his house. The challenges he faces are the climate conditions that cause damage to his crops. Mario likes to take walks with his family. The Carnaval is a custom in the town. People celebrate with their families and friends every year in February.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and wages

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie G. is from the village of Kiorob, Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Jessie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a business venture buying and selling rice and corn grain in the local community. Jessie has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase grains and was used towards her additional working capital. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more corn and rice grains to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Jessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more corn and rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Maria Rosario C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo vive en la vecina ciudad de Azogues o San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues,  es la capital de la provincia del Cañar que  por su ubicación  topográfica es una ciudad bien asoleada desde el punto Este culminante en el  Santuario Franciscano sobre todo en las horas de mas sol produciendo fuertes contrastes  en el sector urbano-arquitectonico, además podemos disfrutar de las belleza de las grandes inclinaciones hasta el cajón del río Burgay.

Nuestra socia tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos quienes se encuentran de 19, 15 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y le ayuda económicamente con el arriendo de la casa y  los estudios de sus hermanos menores que  son estudiantes de secundaria y primaria respectivamente en instituciones de la ciudad,  no recibe ningún apoyo por parte del progenitor de sus  hijos y entre ella y su hija sacan adelante su familia.

María Rosario es comerciante de periódico y billetes de lotería actividad que realiza hace 12 años, trabaja todos los días sin descansar uno solo,  labora desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m. y este ya es como un negocio familiar. Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal gracias a que fue invitada por su hermana, con su crédito comprará más  billetes de lotería.

Su meta es crecer mas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario C. is a member of the community bank "Mujeres de Trabajo". She lives in the neighboring city of Azogues, or otherwise known by its full name San Francisco de Peleusi de Azogues. It is the provincial captial of Canar, that by its geography is a very sunny city. On the eastern-most point is the Franciscan sanctuary whose achictecture is strongly contrasted at high noon, in addition they enjoy the beauty of the great mountains spanning to the canyon of the Burgay river. Our member is 37 years old and she is a single mother of three children aged 19, 15 and 11 years old. Her eldest daughter works and helps her financially with the maintenance of the hosue and with her sibilings' education. They attend high school and primary school in the city. She does not receive any kind of support from the father of the children so it is only up to her and her daughter to take care of the family. Maria Rosario sells newspapers and lottery tickets. It is a business she has been running for the past 12 years. She works every day without ever taking a day to rest. She works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. on this business that has become the family business. She is seeking her second loan through her community bank, following an invitation by her sister to join. This loan will be invested in the purchase of more lottery tickets.. Her goal is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: Gloria Mercedes

texts.es:
La  señora  Gloria Arévalo pertenece al bankito Las Flores, vive en la comunidad Corazón de Jesús en  la parroquia El Valle ubicada al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, limita al norte con la parroquia Paccha, al este la parroquia Santa Ana, al sur la parroquia Tarqui y al oeste la parroquia Turi y la ciudad de Cuenca. La agricultura y la ganadería son las actividades tradicionales de los pobladores de éste sector  principalmente de maíz, fréjol, haba, arveja, cebada, papas, para abastecer el consumo de su comunidad, en cuanto a la actividad artesanal existen talleres de carpintería y de confección de ropa así como de artesanías  que se exportan principalmente a Europa y Estados Unidos.

Ella  tiene 48 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres  hijos que se encuentran de 16, 15 y 5 años, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su último hijo pasa en una guardería, no recibe ninguna ayuda del padre de sus hijos y sola tiene que cubrir los gastos de arriendo, comida, vestido y educación de sus hijos.

Gloria vende billetes de lotería hace ya 15 años y ha podido sacar  adelante a su familia, labora todos los días de domingo a domingo desde las 7:30 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. se encuentra en su octavo ciclo y fue invitada por una amiga que fue socia de éste  banco,  con su nuevo crédito va a comprar más billetes de lotería.

Su meta es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Gloria A. is a member of the small Las Flores bank. She lives in the Corazon de Jesus community in El Valle parish, south-east of Cuenca. It is bordered in the north by the Paccha parish, in the east by the Santa Ana parish, in the south by the Tarqui parish and in the west by the Turi parish and the city of Cuenca. The community's traditional activities are ranching and agriculture; mainly corn, frejol and haba beans, peas, barley and potatoes for the community's consumption. There are also crafters, carpenters, clothing-makers and artists who export mainly to Europe and the United States. Gloria, 48, is a single mother of three children ages 16, 15 and 5. Her two oldest children are in school and her youngest is in daycare. She does not receive any support from her children's father, and she must cover their rent, food, clothing and education costs on her own. She has sold lottery tickets for 15 years and has been able to get her family ahead. She works seven days a week from 7:30 am to 5:00 pm. This is her eighth loan cycle and she was invited by a friend who is also a member of this bank. With this loan, she will buy more lottery tickets. Her goal is to buy a home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lottery tickets (for sale)

loans.name: Porfirio Alejandrino

texts.es:
Porfirio Alejandrino G. P. tiene 57 años, vive con su esposa y 3 hijos, Freddy de 16 años, Mario de 14 años y Danny de 11 años, en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.  
Porfirio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Se dedica a la agricultura, en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas y fréjol, como principal fuente de ingresos de la familia. Hace las compras y ventas en el mercado de San Miguel. 
Porfirio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, abonos y urea. Piensa que el préstamo cambiara la situación económica de la familia. Su meta es comprar un terreno para el mejoramiento de la vivienda. Los desafíos que enfrente son la plaga en los productos y les fenómenos naturales
Le gusta las fiestas del carnaval, el deporte y también cantar en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Porfirio Alejandrino G. P. is 57 years old and lives in the canton of San Miguel in Bolivar Province with his wife and three children: Freddy (age 16), Mario (age 14) and Danny (age 11). He is a member of the Communal Bank “Lotan Bajo”, which is 30 minutes away from the town of San Miguel. The group has a total of 13 members, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Porfirio is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, potatoes, and beans to generate income for his family. He buys and sells his products at the market in San Miguel. Porfirio is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies, compost, and urea. He believes the loan will help change his family’s financial situation. His goal is to buy land so that he can make improvements to his home. The challenges he faces are pests that impact his crops and the occurrence of inclement weather and other natural phenomena.

He enjoys the Carnival festivals, sports, and singing in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies, compost, and urea

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita O. is from the village of Kiorob, Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 52 years old, married, and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Esterlita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nervo Ivan

texts.es:
Nervo Ivan G. M. tiene 26 años, y vive con su familia en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos: Jimena (5 años), Henry (3 años) y Rubén (1 año). 
Nervo es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de su familia. Los productos que más produce son maíz, fréjol, arbeja y papas. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado del cantón San Miguel una vez a la semana, los días de la feria. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar productos agrícolas y pagar peones. Con la compro de los insumos, se espera obtener resultados en la cosecha.  Su sueño seria comprar un terreno y construir su casa propia. Los desafíos que enfrente son las plagas a los cultivos, falta de lluvia y enfermedades a sus hijos.
Le gusta las fiestas del patrón San Miguel, visitar parientes, irse de pesca al rió con su familia y jugar gallos de pelea.
texts.en:
Nervo Ivan G. M., 26, lives with his family in San Miguel canton, Bolívar province. He has three children: Jimena (5 years old), Henry (3 years old) and Rubén (1 year old). Nervo is a member of the Lotan Bajo communal bank which is located half an hour from the town of San Miguel. There is a total of 13 members who are, for the most part, farmers. His main source of family income is farming; his main crops are corn, broad bean, peas and potatoes. He buys and sells his products once a week in San Miguel’s farmers market on farm day. He is requesting funds to buy farm supplies and to pay his field hands. The purchase of supplies will lead to good harvests, he hopes. His dream would be to buy a lot and build his own house. The challenges he faces are plant pests, lack of rain and his children’s’ illnesses. He enjoys the St. Michael patron saint festivities, visiting relatives, fishing in the river with his family and participating in cock fights.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pay farm hands.

loans.name: Baeda

texts.en: This borrower is 36 years old and married to a man who works for SOS Jeunes, an organization that helps troubled youths. Together, they have two children. She sells certain fuels and cereals from her home, and has been in business since 2005. She has requested her first microloan from Kiva partner, WAGES, for 400,000 XOF to purchase firewood, charcoal, maize, millet and beans.

loans.use: To purchase wood, charcoal and cereals

loans.name: Vicente German

texts.es:
Vicente German G. M. tiene 24 años.  Es soltero y vive con sus padres en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Vicente es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Vicente se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeño. Cultiva maíz, trigo, papas y fréjol. Hace las compras y ventas en el mercado de San Miguel cada 15 días, el día de la feria. 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la agricultura e insumos. El crédito le ayudará a tener más dinero y más tiempo libre. Sus sueños para los 5 próximos años es casarse, salir adelante, tener una casa, un carro. Los desafíos que enfrente son la falta de lluvia y las cosechas.
Le gusta hacer deportes los fines de semana, jugar gallos de pelea y también bailar y cocinar.
texts.en:
Vicente German G. M., 24, is single and lives with his parents in San Miguel canton, Bolívar province. He is a member of the Lotan Bajo communal bank which is located half an hour away from the town of San Miguel. The bank has a total of 13 members who are, for the most part, farmers. Vicente has been a farmer since he was a little boy. He grows corn, wheat, potatoes and broad beans. He buys and sells at San Miguel’s market every two weeks on market day. He is asking for funds to invest in farm supplies. The loan will help him have more money and more free time. His dream for the next five years is to get married, to get ahead and have his own house and a car. The challenges he faces are the lack of rain and the crops. He likes to play sports on weekends, to participate in cock fights, and also to dance and cook.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Wilma Fátima

texts.es:
Wilma Fátima V. I. tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus 3 hijos, Osvaldo de 13 años, Rafael de 9 años y Fernanda de 16 meses. Ellos viven en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Vilma es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Vilma se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeña. Cultiva maíz, trigo y habas. Los vende cada 15 días en el mercado de San Miguel.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos. Su sueño es que Dios les ayuda y les da un poquito más para salir adelante y comprar una casa. Los desafíos que ella enfrente son las enfermedades de los niños y en el negocio los precios bajos porque hay sobreproducción.
Le gusta bailar y cocinar y disfrutar de las fiestas del fin de año y carnaval en el cantón.
texts.en:
Wilma Fátima V. I. is 29 years old, single, and lives with her three children: Osvaldo (age 13), Rafael (age 9), and Fernanda (age 16 months). They live in the canton of San Miguel in Bolivar Province.

Wilma is a member of the Communal Bank “Lotan Bajo”, which is 30 minutes away from the town of San Miguel. The group has a total of 13 members, most of whom engage in agriculture.
