Wilma has been farming from a young age. She grows corn, wheat, and beans and sells these products every 15 days at the market in San Miguel. Wilma is requesting a loan to buy supplies. She dreams that God will help her family and provide them a little more so that they can get ahead and buy a house. Her greatest challenges are when her children get sick and her business deals with low prices due to overproduction. She likes dancing and cooking, and also takes time to enjoy the festivities during New Years and Carnival that take place in the canton.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Juana, tiene 54 años la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos todos independientes; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista de compra y venta de productos secos y  granos; La socia vende ( moraya (papa deshidratada), pallares, habas secas, maíz de diferentes variedad y tipos, lentejas y poroto. La socia lleva los productos a Urubamba y Cusco. Nuestra socia también se dedica a la artesanía desde hace unos meses atras y está aprendiendo este arte para que alterne sus actividades en un futuro cercano con la venta de estos tejidos. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos y llevarlos a vender.

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the Colquecancha community bank; she lives in the Raqchi community, Urubamba, Cusco. She is 54, married, and has 3 independent children. She does housework and retail; she buys and sells dry goods and grains. She sells moraya (dehydrated potatoes), butter beans, dried broad beans, lentils, green beans and different varieties and types of corn. She brings her products to Urubamba and Cusco. She also started doing handicrafts several months ago, and she is learning this art in order to sell them in the future. She is requesting this loan to buy dry goods to sell. Juana is grateful to all the investors who are making this dream possible, and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dry goods to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 33 years old, married, and has six children. He has a retail shop business in Hoima in Uganda which has been operational for two years. He is the breadwinner for his family who live in a house he has managed to build through his hard work. He dreams of educating his children to university levevl and setting up a wholesale shop. He came to know about the Hofokam credit facility through a friend who encouraged him to grow his business with the easy, accessible, and cheap credit funds, and this is his third loan. The purpose of the loan funds is to buy sugar, soap, salt and 'posho' (cornmeal) for reselling.

loans.use: buying sugar, salt, soap, and 'posho' for resale

loans.name: Jaime Estuardo

texts.es:
Jaime Estuardo M. B. tiene 49 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y 2 hijos, Mauricio de 21 años y Andrés de 15 años en el cantón de San Miguel, en la provincia de Bolívar.
Jaime es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Jaime se dedica al negocio: compra y venta de ganado y productos agrícolas, como principal fuente de ingreso de su familia. Los que mas comercializa son ganado vacuno y el choclo. Compra sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en San Miguel y Guaranda. 
Solicita el préstamo para la agricultura y para capital de trabajo en su negocio. Piensa que el crédito le ayudará para el negocio, en las compras y ventas de productos. Su sueño seria de mejorar el modelo del carro y comprar un terreno. Enfrenta desafió de sobreproducción de productos que baja los precios y no se tiene utilizador.  
Le gusta salir de paseo con su familia, las costumbres del carnaval y fiestas de patrón San Miguel que celebra con amigos y familia.
texts.en:
Jaime Estuardo M. B. is 49 years old and lives in the canton of San Miguel in Bolivar Province. He and his wife have two children, Mauricio (age 21) and Andrés (age 15).

Jaime is a member of the Communal Bank “Lotan Bajo”, which is 30 minutes away from the town of San Miguel. The group has a total of 13 members, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Jaime is dedicated to his two businesses, buying and selling cattle and growing agricultural products. These activities are the main source of income for his family. The two products he sells the most are cattle and corn. He acquires his products in San Miguel and also sells in both San Miguel and Guaranda. Jaime is requesting a loan to use for farming and to increase the operating capital for his business. He believes the loan will help his business so that he can buy and sell products. His dreams include upgrading the model of his car and buying a plot of land. The main challenge he faces is overproduction since his products can only be sold at lower prices since there are not enough buyers.

Jaime enjoys spending time with his family. He takes time to celebrate Carnival and the San Miguel patron saint festivals with his friends and family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in farming & increase the operating capital for his business

loans.name: Cecilia Veronica

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo esta ubicado en la ciudad de Azogues o conocida tambien como San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues capital de la provincia del Azuay, urbe que por su ubicación geográfica  goza  de un clima asoleado, permitiendo una fisonomia de gran belleza durante las horas de mas luz solar ya que produce contrastes que acentua su distribución urbano-arquitectonica, ademas podemos apreciar las grandes inclinaciones hasta el cajón del río Burgay.

Cecilia  Verónica C. es una de las socias más jovenes del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo,  con apenas  diecinueve años cuenta consu tienda de abarrotes hace poco tiempo para ayudar a su familia economicamente, sus padres son comerciantes y gracias al trabajo conjunto ya cuentan con su casa propia. Nuestra socia este semestre entrara a la universidad y estudiara Psicología Clinica.

Este es su segundo ciclo con el banco comunal y con el dinero que reciba invertirá en la matricula de su universidad.

Tiene como meta terminar sus estudios y ser una excelente profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Mujeres de Trabajo" (Working Women), is located in the city of Azogues, which is also known as San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues. It is the capital of the province of Azuay. It is a large city, and because of it's geographic location, it enjoys a sunny climate, and it is very beautiful during the sunniest times because there are contrasts that accentuate its urban architecture. We can also appreciate the large slopes that go towards the Burgay River. Cecilia Verónica C. is one of the youngest members of the communal bank. She is barely 19, and she has had her own grocery store for a little while to help her family economically. Her parents are merchants, and thanks to their joint effort, they own their own home. Cecilia will start college this semester and will study clinical psychology. This is her second loan with the communal bank, and with the money she receives, she will invest in her tuition. Her goal is to finish school and to be an excellent professional.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Simón Bolívar

texts.es:
Simón Bolívar B. V. tiene 22 años de edad. Es soltero y vive con sus padres en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.  Simón es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Simón es agricultor, cultiva productos como maíz, fréjol, arbeja y papas. Hace las compras y ventas cada fin de semana en San Miguel. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar ganado. Piensa que el préstamo le ayudará a comprar y vender más. Su sueño es salir a pasear y tener una esposa.
Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura, salir a hacer deportes como jugar volley y fútbol.
texts.en:
Simón is 22 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in San Miguel, located in the Bolívar province. Simón is a member of the “Rural Window of Lotan Bajo,” which is located 30 minutes from the town of San Miguel. There are 13 members, most of who are dedicated to agriculture. Simón raises crops such as corn, beans, peas, and potatoes. He buys and sells in San Miguel on the weekends. He is asking for this loan in order to buy livestock. He feels that this loan will allow him to buy and sell more. He dreams of travelling and getting married. He likes to work in agriculture and playing sports such as volleyball and soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Roxana, ella tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es madre soltera con 2 menores hijos, ella se divorció de su esposo y es madre y padre para los menores, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura y la ganadería, la socia también cría animales menores tales como (cuyes, chanchos y aves de corral, gallinas, pollos, patos). Nuestra socia también elabora tejidos de a mano con figuras geométricas, la socia empezó a interesarse en este arte al ver que sus otras compañeras de bancos comunales lo hacían y lo llevaban a vender al mirador de Taray punto en el que diversos buses de turismo a diario hacen su parada para tomar fotos del valle sagrado de los inkas y ellas se acomodaron a los alrededores del mirador con todas sus artesanías y venden sus brazaletes a cuarto de dólar cada uno. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas, abono, y todo lo que respecta el sembrío de tierras de cultivos de papa y maíz.

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, "Colquecancha." She lives in the community of Raqchi, which belongs to the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. Our member is señora Roxana. She is 28 and is the mother of 2 young children. She divorced from her husband and is both mother and father to her children. She alternates her activities at home with agriculture and raising livestock. She also raises small animals like guinea pigs; pigs; and poultry like hens, chickens, and ducks. She also makes weavings by hand with geometric figures. She became interested in art after seeing other what other members of communal banks were doing. They took what they made to sell at the viewpoint in Taray, a place where different tourist buses come every day to take pictures of the sacred valley of the Incas. The other members would go around the viewpoint selling their handmade items and would sell their bracelets for $0.25 each. Roxana is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and everything that is involved in growing corn and potatoes. She is thankful to the investors that make it possible for her to realize this dream, and she promises to pay back her debt within the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and everything involved in growing potatoes and corn.

loans.name: Kaï

texts.fr: Née en 1984 à Allada dans le département de l'Atlantique, V. Kaï est mariée à ALLOGOU Hervé, un chauffeur. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé. La famille vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Ahito à Allada. Kaï  vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Kaï n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a environs cinq ans que Kaï mène comme activité, la vente de produits cosmétiques à Allada, ce qui lui permet de faire face à ses besoins et d'assurer les besoins de son enfant. Kaï achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Kaï a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué le remboursement. Dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement, d'accoître sa clientèle et de mieux la satisfaire, Kaï sollicite un deuxième appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1984 in Allada in the Department of the Atlantic, Kaï V. is married to Hervé ALLOGOU, a driver. The couple have a child who is attending school. The family has lived for the past ten years in the Ahito borough of Allada. Kaï helps her husband and shares with him the various household expenses. Kaï has never attended school. Some five years ago she began selling beauty products in Allada, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her child. She gets her supplies from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Kaï has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. She is now requesting a second financial loan, to increase her working capital, expand her customer base and improve customer satisfaction.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a father of four, aged 28. He operates a bar which sustains his children and his wife. He lives in his own house in Kibaale, Uganda which accommodates his family and the bar business. He has been in the bar business for five years now. He says he started selling small quantities of alcohol but has seen his bar grow over the years with the help of the profits made and credit facilities from Hofokam. 

Besides the bar, John deals in selling beans and maize to earn additional income for his family. He is to use the loan funds to buy a television screen and generator for his bar business.

loans.use: buying a television screen and generator for his bar business

loans.name: Blanca Magali

texts.es:
Blanca Magali G. B. tiene 21 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Blanca es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Blanca trabaja en la agricultura, en la siembra de diferentes productos como maíz y trigo. Los compra y vende en los diferentes mercados del cantón. Solicita el préstamo para la agricultura y espera utilizarlo bien. Su sueño es incrementar su actividad para poder ayudar a su familia y seguir adelante con sus estudios. Los desafíos por cuales tiene miedo son enfermedades o también una mala administración del negocio.
Le gusta hace deporte como basket y bailar cuando hay programas.
texts.en:
Blanca is 21 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the hamlet of San Miguel, located in the Bolívar province. She is a member of the “Rural Window of Lotan Bajo,” which is located 30 minutes from the town of San Miguel. There are 13 members, most of who are dedicated to agriculture. Blanca raises different crops, such as corn and wheat. She buys and sells in different markets around the hamlet. She is asking for this loan and will use it wisely. She wants to increase her activity in order to be able to help her parents and continue with her studies. She is always concerned about plant diseases or poor management of her business. She likes sports such as basketball and dancing.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: María Belén

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. María Belén, La socia tiene 39 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores (cuyes, chanchos, patos y otras aves de corral, gallinas, pollos), también la socia también se dedica a la artesanía, ella comenzó este oficio para mejorar su económica; la socia vio que algunas de sus compañeras en la comunidad iniciaban el negocio de la artesanía de manera informal en el mirador de Raqchi e inmediato aprendió a tejer a mano diversos motivos de la cultura Inka y fue entrando poco a poco en el nuevo negocio y desde entonces hasta el día de hoy lleva sus tejidos a exponer a este mirador que hoy conforman un grupo de señoras de la comunidad de manera formal común sindicato electo y alternan sus salidas para que todos se vean beneficiados con el turismo rico en la zona del valle Inka. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas sintéticas y transporte para la ciudad el Cusco, una parte de este dinero también servirá para la alimentación de sus hijos y mejorar un poco la casita en la que viven.

 Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, "Colquecancha." She lives in the community of Raqchi, which belongs to the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. Our member is señora María Belén. She is 39, is married, and has 6 children. She alternates her activities at home with agriculture and raising young animals (guinea pigs, pigs, ducks, chickens, and hens). She also makes hand-made goods. She started this trade to improve her family's economic situation. She saw that some of the other members of the community were starting informal businesses selling hand-made goods at the viewpoint in Raqchi, and she learned to weave by hand. She started her business little by little, and still today she takes her weavings to display at this viewpoint. She is part of a group of women in the community who alternate their trips to the viewpoint so all of them are benefited by the rich tourism of the Inca Valley. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of synthetic wool and transportation to the city of Cusco. Part of this money will also go towards feeding her children and improving the house in which they live a little. She is thankful to all of the investors that make this dream possible, and she promises to pay back her debt in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of synthetic wool and transportation to the city of Cusco.  She will also use part of the money to feed her children and to improve the house in which they live.

loans.name: Hipólito

texts.es:
Hipólito tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a su unico hijo dependiente en el anexo Las Mercedes del caserío Lagartera, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, conformado en su mayoría por un conjunto de caseríos que distan mucho uno de otro. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años, el cría ovejas y cabras en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, para asegurarse el buen desarrollo de sus animales les brinda alimento balanceado y pastos naturales. Cada quince dias se dirige al mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo para ofrecer a sus animales en venta. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para su economía,adicionalmente se dedica al trabajo agrícola en los diversos campos de cultivos de la zona.

Hipólito desea adquirir mas animales y alimento balanceado para criarlos y venderlos. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que contribuyan al logro de su objetivo.

Hipólito, al igual que la mayor parte de pobladores de la zona, es una persona honrada, de vida sencilla y apacible. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hipólito is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and only son in the Las Mercedes annex of the Lagartera living area, a rural area in the Mórrope district. It is located in the Lambayeque province and is one hour and 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo He has been raising sheep and goats in corals behind his home, for more than years. He makes sure to provide his animals with a balanced diet in order to ensure their good development. He travels to the Moshoqueque market in Chiclayo every two weeks to sell his animals. He also raises crops in the nearby fields. Hipólito would like to acquire more animals and feed, so he has requested this loan of 2,000 PEN ($700) through Edpyme Alternativa, to help him reach his goal. Hipólito, like most of the other people in his zone, is honest and leads a simple life. His greatest desire is to continue to work in order to offer his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock and feed

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr: Née en 1986 à Djidja au Bénin, A. Clarisse est mariée à ASSANKPON Gérôme, un chauffeur. Le couple a six enfants à leurs charges, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Clarisse et sa famille vivent enssemble au quartier Tchinvié à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, depuis un an. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Clarisse a très peu fréquenté, et a appris ensuite la couture. Clarisse exerce cette activité depuis près de sept ans.  A côté de cette activité, Clarisse  vend des tissus et aussi des produits vivriers à son domicile et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est au marché de Tchèti au Bénin, que Clarisse achète ses produits. C'est la première fois que Clarisse sollicite un prêt de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer principalement son activité de vente de produits vivriers et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1986 in Allada in Benin, Clarisse A. is married to Gérôme ASSANKPON, a driver. The couple have six children under their care, all of whom are attending (or have attended) school. For the past year, Clarisse has lived together with her family in the Tchinvié borough of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. The couple share the various household expenses. Clarisse has had very little schooling, and learned sewing thereafter. She has been a seamstress for seven years. As a side business, she also sells clothing fabric and fresh produce from her home and in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. She buys her products at the Tchèti market in Benin. This is the first time Clarisse has requested a loan from ALIDé, with the main objective of strengthening her produce retail business, and to better satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing fabric, thread, and fresh produce (sesame, peanuts)

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.en: This young lady is 30 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband is a chauffeur. To help support her family, she sells “Pure Water” wholesale as well as fuel from her home. She has requested her first microloan from Kiva partner, WAGES, of 300,000 XOF. With it she will purchase rice, water and fuel products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice, water and fuel products to sell

loans.name: Carmen Marina

texts.es:
Carmen Marina V. I. tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus 5 hijos: Lourdes (26 años), Verónica (24), Edith (19), Mauricio (17) y Jessica (16). Ellos viven en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Carmen es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Carmen se dedica a la agricultura y cultiva maíz, fréjol, habas y trigo. Hace las compras y ventas en el mercado de San Miguel cada 2 semanas. Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos. Piensa que si lo invertirá bien, tendría más dinero. Su sueño es comprar una casa y crecer más el negocio. Enfrenta desafió con la salud.
Le gusta salir a caminar, cocinar, bailar y cantar canciones antiguas. Carmen trabaja 7 días por semana.
texts.en:
Carmen Marina is 45 years old. She is single and lives with her five children; Lourdes (26), Verónica (24), Edith (19), Mauricio (17), and Jessica (16). They live in the hamlet of San Miguel in the Bolívar province. Carmen belongs to the “Lotan Bajo Rural Window,” located 30 minutes from the town of San Miguel. There are a total of 13 members, most of who are dedicated to agriculture. Carmen raises corn, beans, peas, and wheat. She buys and sells in the San Miguel marketplace every two weeks. She is asking for this loan in order to buy fertilizer. She believes that she will have more money if she invests it well and dreams of growing her business and buying a house. She has some problems with her health, but likes to take strolls, cook, dance, and sing old songs. Carmen works seven days a week.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
Eloisa M.  Cruz  es una señora de 56 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y su  hijo y en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja. 

Desde hace 4 años que doña Eloisa inició un negocio de costura y confección de ropa. Ella remienda y elabora diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir especialmente uniformes de enfermeros, los cuales vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores e incluso la llegan a buscar a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. Dice que el poder brindar un buen servicio a las personas y cumplir con sus exigencias, son la base del éxito del negocio.

Actualmente doña Eloisa requiere un préstamo de ¢654,000 (seiscientos Cincuenta y cuatro mil colones) para comprar una máquina especial para coser y materiales como telas, hilos, etc. Con esta inversión espera poder incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los  productos. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá atraer a más clientes, ofrecer mejores alternativas y mejorar considerablemente la calidad de sus productos.

Doña Eloisa es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y se encuentra muy entusiasmada ya que con el crédito su negocio mejora al igual que sus ingresos
texts.en:
Eloisa is 56 years old and lives with her husband and son in a community called, Hernández. It’s located in Los Chiles, in the province of Alajuela. This community is known for its mountainous terrain and grand landscapes. The climate is very humid and is located along a road, very near the country’s northern border. Its main economic activities are livestock and agriculture, specifically basic grains, tubers, and oranges. Eloisa started her clothing manufacture and tailoring business four years ago. She repairs and makes different types of clothing, especially nurses’ uniforms, which she sells to different businesses within her own and the surrounding communities. Her small business has helped improve her life considerably. She tells us that providing good service to her customers and keeping her promises are the foundations for her business. Eloisa needs a loan of ¢654,000 ($1,200) to buy a special sewing machine and supplies, such as fabric, thread, etc. With this investment, she hopes to be able to increase her production and improve the quality of her products. She recognizes that this loan will help her to attract more customers, offer them better alternatives, and improve the quality of her products considerably. Eliosa is a member of the “Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo” (Communal Credit Company for Development) communal bank, one of a hundred EDESA affiliates in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she is very excited because her business and her income will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine and supplies

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
El grupo Solidaridad está integrado por  tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Gioconda del Carmen C. quien tiene una pequeña comideria la cual inicio con la venta de unos pocos platos de comida a los trabajadores del taller mecanico junto a su casa.Es entoces que decide invertir mas e instala su comideria además de que empieza a vender por las noches noches fritanga.
Ella tiene cinco hijos de 23,20,18,17 y 13 años los cuales le ayudan en el negocio despues de sus estudios.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Concepción de María N. quien vende calzado y ropa usada, María Lucia O. V. desde hace 20 años realiza tortillas y Kenia Vanessa C. comercializa bisuteria,helados y chocobananos. Ellas tienen la meta de incrementar más sus negocios para poder progresar.
texts.en:
The “Soledaridad” group is made up of three hard working women. Gioconda has small eatery, which she started from the money she made selling food to the mechanic shop employees, located next to her home. It was then that she decided to invest in installing her eatery and begin selling fried foods in the evening. She has five children, ages 23, 20, 18, 17, and 13. They help her in the business after finishing their studies for the day. The other members of the group are Concepción, who sells shoes and second hand clothing, María who has been selling tortillas for the past 20 years, and Kenia who sells sundries, ice cream, and frozen bananas. Their goal is to grow their businesses so that they can move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La Sra. Eusebia Velazquez tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera, su vida es su negocio de Librería y Copetin que monto con mucho sacrificio hace ya 5 años, le ayuda su hermana con quien vive en el barrio centro donde tiene su comercio.
El local esta ubicado frente a un Colegio prestigioso de la Ciudad de Coronel Oviedo. 
Comenta que muchas veces por falta de capital no puede cumplir con la totalidad de la demanda de sus clientes.
La Sra. Eusebia recibio una promoción de la Fundación Paraguaya que otorga créditos a personas emprendedoras apoyando el trabajo, y le vino muy bien el ofrecimiento y solicito su crédito, agradeciendo la confianza hacia su persona y valorando la oportunidad que la Institución ofrece a gentes como ella.
Ella solicito el crédito para la compra de articulos de libreria como(cuaderno, bolígrafos, hojas)
texts.en:
Eusebia is 45 years old. She is single and her business, a bookstore which she began five years ago, is her life. Her sister helps her and lives in the same neighborhood where the shop is located. The location is across from a school in the city of Coronel Oviedo. She tells us that she is not always able to meet her customers’ needs, due to a lack of working capital. She received literature from Fundación Paraguaya, telling of the entrepreneur support programs and she liked the idea, so she requested a loan. She is grateful for the trust and values the opportunity that the institution has given her. She will use the money to buy bookstore items, such as notebooks and paper.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rolando Ismael

texts.es:
Rolando Ismael A. B. tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres y 2 hijos: Paúl (6 años) y Jose (8 años). Ellos viven en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Rolando es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Rolando se dedica a la ganadería como fuente de ingresos y a la agricultura. Lo que mas compra y vende es el ganado vacuno y siembra maíz. Realiza las ventas y compras en el mercado de Guaranda. Solicita el préstamo para la ganadería como capital de trabajo. Piensa que el préstamo le ayudara a mejorar en parte su calidad de vida. Su sueño es seguir estudiando e incrementar más el negocio por medio de los préstamos.
Le gusta trabajar, jugar volley ball en los ratos libres, y los carnavales que se celebran todos los años con amigos y familias.
texts.en:
Rolando is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and two children; Paul (6) and Jose (8). They live in the hamlet of San Miguel located in the Bolívar province. Rolando is with the “Lotan Bajo Rural Window,” located 30 minutes from the town of San Miguel. There are 13 members, mostly dedicated to agriculture. Rolando raises livestock (cattle) and raises corn. He buys and sells in the Guaranda market. He is asking for this loan to use as working capital. He believes that this will help him to improve his quality of life. He wants to continue his studies and grow his business with the help of loans. He enjoys working, and playing volleyball in his spare time. He also likes going to the annual carnivals with family and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eriyasi

texts.en:
Eriyasi is a father of three children, aged 47. He operates a bar in a rural township of Bugwara, Kibaale in Uganda which sustains his children and his peasant wife. He lives in his own house in Kibaale, Uganda with his family of five people. He has been in the bar business for six years now. He says he used to be in the piggery business before starting his own bar. 

Besides the bar, Eriyasi deals in selling beans and maize to earn additional income for his family. In his area, produce is a good business venture to earn or supplement income as trucks from the urban areas flood the rural areas buying food to sell in towns. This is his first loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to buy beer, sodas, and airtime to sell in his bar.

loans.use: buying beer, sodas and airtime for his bar business

loans.name: Giovanna Jazelli

texts.es:
Giovanna Jazelli M. F. es una buena hija y hermana, que tiene 19 años de edad  y un gran corazón, pues siempre busca ayudar a sus mamá y a su hermano menor;  en el barrio Tintal de Bogotá todos conocen  su dedicación a un negocio de su propiedad, que atiende con su madre, donde vende de todo un poco: comercializa artículos de papelería y miscelánea, tanto  como cuadernos, lapiceros, productos de belleza como gel y esmaltes y así mismo aprovecha este punto para vender minutos a teléfonos  fijos  y a celulares, que le representan otro ingreso y que es lo que atrae la venta de las mercancias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crédito por valor de $500.000 COP, pues quiere comprar  tinturas y gel  para el cabello que tienen una buena rotación en su negocio y también articulos de papelería como cuadernos, bloques de hojas para imprimir, pues tiene una clientela de estudiantes que le compran usualmente.

Esta gran emprendedora, inició su negocio hace algo más de 2 años con recursos propios,  su primer mercado doméstico fue en el conjunto residencial donde vivía, ahora conocen su miscelánea en los  alrededores del sector.Giovanna tiene la gran aspiración de seguir ampliando su negocio, pues sabe que en la medida en que aumente el volumen de ventas, sus ingresos también y tendría la capacidad de acceder a la universidad porque sueña con estudiar medicina y es su gran desafio.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a good daughter and sister. She is 19 years old and has a big heart, as she is always looking for ways to help her mother and younger brother. Everyone in the Tintal neighborhood of Bogotá knows of her dedication to her business and property where she cares for her mother. She sells a little of everything, such as paper goods, notebooks, writing instruments, beauty products, and other miscellaneous items. She also sells phone cards for landlines and cell phones, which provide another source of income and also helps attract more customers. She is asking for a loan of 500,000 COP ($275) in order to buy hair coloring and gel, which sells well. She will also buy more paper goods such as notebooks and printer paper. She has regular customers who are students. This entrepreneur started her business, with her own resources, more than two years ago. She began selling out of her home. Now she is known around the community. Giovanna wants to continue to grow her business because she knows that increasing her sales will also increase her income. This will also give her the opportunity to attend university because her biggest goal is to become a doctor.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Mètolé Louise

texts.fr: M. Mètolé Louise est née en 1980 et est mariée à AWLIWA Félix. Il y a près de six ans que Louise vit avec son mari au quartier Adjina dans le troisième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Le couple se partage les différentes charges du foyer. Louise n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Louise  mène comme activité, la vente de maïs, de "sodabi" (boisson alcoolisée locale), et aussi du charbon de bois à son domicile; Louise achète ses produits à Abomey, dans le département du Zou au Bénin. Louise exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année et a bien remboursé le prêt antérieur qu'elle avait reçu de ALIDé. Louise désire augmenter son fonds de roulement et élever le niveau de son activité pour attirer plus de clientèle et se faire plus de revenu. C'est la raison pour laquelle Louise sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Mètolé Louise M. was born in 1980 and is married to Félix AWLIWA. About six years ago, she settled with her husband in the Adjina neighbourhood in the third borough of Porto-Novo. The couple shares family expenses. Louise has never attended school. To meet her needs, she has been selling corn, “sodabi” (a local fermented beverage), and charcoal from her home. She gets her supplies from Abomey in the Zou Department of Benin. She has been in business for the past ten years, and has fully repaid the previous loan granted by ALIDé. Louise wishes to increase her working capital and raise her activity to new levels, so as to attract more customers and generate more revenue. This is why she is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of corn and charcoal, and containers of "sodabi"

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Antonia, Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos ellos dependientes de los socios; Nuestra socia se dedica  a la artesanía ella teje pulseras a mano con lanas de distintos colores y con infinitos motivos andinos, La socia lleva a vender sus pulseras a un valor no mayor que cuarto centavo de dólar cada uno y los vende en el mirador de Raqchi a los turistas que hacen su parada en este bello mirador para apreciar el paisaje; Nuestra socia también realiza diferentes tapices y muñecas de trapo para que tenga mayor variedad de artesanía, el esposo de la socia se dedica íntegramente a la agricultura y juntos mantienen su hogar y cada día mejoran su calidad de vida, ellos también destinan el ingreso de las artesanías y la venta de los cultivos de sus tierras a los estudios de sus hijos. Nuestra socia solicita el dinero para comprar material de trabajo y algunas variedades de artesanías para vender.

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Colquecancha Communal Bank. Our member lives in the Raqchi community, which belongs to the Urubamba province, Cusco department. Our member is Antonia. She is 45, married, and has five children. The children are all dependent upon the colleagues. Our member devotes herself to handicrafts. She knits bracelets by hand. She uses different colors of wool with an infinite number of Andean motifs. The member takes her bracelets to sell for no more that a quarter of a dollar each. She sells at the Raqchi viewpoint. She sells to the tourists who stop at this beautiful viewpoint to appreciate the scenery. Our member also makes tapestry and rag dolls to have a greater variety of handicrafts. The husband of our member devotes himself entirely to agriculture. Together they support the household. Everyday they improve their quality of life. The income from the handicrafts and the sale of their crops from their fields is earmarked for their children’s education. Our member is requesting a loan to buy work materials and a variety of handicrafts to sell. Our member is grateful to all of the lenders who make the fulfillment of this dream possible. She promised to pay all of her debt according to the established time line.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: By work materials and a variety of handicrafts to sell

loans.name: María Arlinda

texts.es:
María Arlinda L. O. de 27 años desde el 2000 inicio con cien dolares su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado el cual por medio del trabajo arduo y los préstamos se ha desarrollado.En la actualidad además de invertir en estos rubros tambien distribuye electrodomesticos. 

Ella asegura que adim le apoyado mucho tanto economicamente como en su crecimiento personal al participar del proceso de capacitación en el que sea visto motivada y le enseñan como incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Arlinda L. O. is 27 years old. In 2000 she took 100 dollars and started her business of selling clothes and shoes. Through hard work and loans it has developed. At present, in addition to investing in these things, she also distributes appliances. She maintains that ADIM has supported her financially and in her personal growth. Participating in the training has motivated her and taught her how to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For merchandise such as clothing, shoes and appliances.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a young man living in a remote area of Kibaale, Uganda. He is married to a peasant farmer and together they have two children, aged 3 and 1 years. Though he is young, Fred owns a residential house already. He deals in produce (groundnuts, beans, and maize) as his business. He says transport of his purchases is his major hardship and he hopes to address it one day by buying his own motorcycle. 

At 30 years of age, he says he can achieve that feat over time through hard work in selling dry foods. This is his first loan from HOFOKAM and he is to use the loan funds to buy groundnuts, beans, maize for resale.

loans.use: buying groundnuts (peanuts), beans, maize for resale

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa de 38 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, es madre soltera tiene una hija de 15 años, Rosa a los 17 años estudio costura en “OSCU” (centro de aprendizaje artesanal) aprendió todo tipo de peinados y cortes de cabello. 

Por la falta de oportunidades ella tuvo practicar lo que había aprendido sin terminar los estudios porque tuvo que poder solventar su hogar, poco a poco compro vitrinas y readecuo la sala de su casa  para el local del salón de belleza. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h30 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Hace tinturados, manicuri, pedicuri, cortes de cabellos, alisados etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tintes, cosméticos y vitrinas para su negocio, en el futuro quiere estudiar para tener un titulo de belleza
texts.en:
Rosa, age 38, lives in an urban area called Fortín on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She is a single mother, and she as a 15 year old daughter. When Rosa was 17 she studied fashion at “OSCU” (center for learning handicrafts). She learned all types of hair styles and ways to cut hair. Due to the lack of opportunities, she had to do what she had learned without finishing her studies. She had to be able to support her household. Little by little she bought display cases and redid her living room in her house. She made it the location of her beauty salon. She now works from 8:30 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. everyday. She does dye jobs, manicures, pedicures, hair cuts, and straightening, etc. She will use the loan to buy tints, cosmetics, and display cases for her business. In the future she wants to study to have a beauty certificate.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tints, cosmetics, and a display case

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
“Por 15 años participó en el banco Comunal Mateo Pumacahua”

Florencia pertenece al banco comunal “Mateo Pumacahua” de la Asociación Arariwa, es natural de la ciudad Chinchero, tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos.  Actualmente, Victoria cuenta con un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en vender comestibles en su tienda para lo cual a inicio se le hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se presentó la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal y por primera vez se prestó 100 dólares hace 15 años. Su actividad económica complementaria es vender chicha, cerveza y gaseosas los días domingos en la feria dominical. 

Florencia es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario sacar adelante a sus familiares. Ahora, que su negocio va creciendo  y cuenta con un capital, ella requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar 120 kilos de maíz pues cada kilo cuesta 2.20 soles.  El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesionales a sus hijos. 

Florencia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
“She has participated in the Mateo Pumacahua cooperative bank for 15 years”. Florencia belongs to the “Mateo “Pumacahua” cooperative bank of the Arariwa Association. She is from the city of Chinchero, 52 years old, married, and has three children. Currently, Victoria has a small business selling food items in her store. She started the business because things were a bit difficult and she didn’t have much money. The opportunity presented itself to join the cooperative bank, and she received her first loan of $100 dollars 15 years ago. As a complement to her enterprise, she also sells chicha, beer and sodas at the Sunday market. Florencia is a hard-working and entrepreneurial person who is always looking for ways to get ahead. With the effort she puts in each and every day, she is able to help support her family. Now that her business is growing and is generating some income, she needs a loan to augment her working capital. She wants to buy 120 kilos of corn, and each kilo costs 2.20 Peruvian soles. The wish of this member is to help her children become professionals. Florencia is very grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium, and concurrently commits to fulfilling her loan installment payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Florencia requires the loan to buy 120 kilos of corn.

loans.name: San Cayetano I Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra trabajando en varias actividades de manera conjunta para contar con fondod comunes a parte de las activides que cada una reliza con su familia.
El comité les ayuda a todas a organizar mejor sus activida, ademas de un buen manejo de los ingresos ya que reciben asesoramiento y todas agraden por ello.
Entre las actividades mas comunes que ejercen estas señoras se tiene la venta de ropas y comestibles, así también la Doña Modesta quien se dedica a la confeccion de vestidos de ropas para vender especialmen trajes, pantalones, y otros.
Ella quiere anexar a su taller venta de otros tipos de ropas para solicita el crédito que invertirá en la compra de remara de algodón y licra, jeans, camperas y otros para competir con la otras tiendas cercanas.
texts.en:
This group is working together in various activities. They are doing this in order to have common funds that are separate from the activities each one does with their family. The group helps all of them to better organize their activities. Also, they help with good management of their earnings. They receive advice, and they are all grateful for it. Among the most common activities these women do is selling clothes and food. Modesta makes clothes to sell. She mainly makes suits, pants, and other things. She wants to add on to her shop and sell other types of clothing. She is requesting the loan to buy cotton and lycra t-shirts, jeans, jackets, and other items. She wants to do this to compete with other stores that are nearby.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy t-shirts, jeans, jackets, and other items

loans.name: José Leoncio

texts.es:
José Leoncio tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica a la agricultura  y comercio, que con sus ingresos apoya a la economía domestica, ellos tienen 4 hijos, mayores de edad, pero apoyan a sus padres en las tareas del campo.
Desde hace 20 años se dedican a los trabajos de las cosechas, dentro de sus planes a corto plazo esta diversificación de las siembras, por otras que tenga un alto índice de consumo, para este propósito solicita un préstamo,  para la compra de materiales agrícolas (fertilizantes, pesticidas, semillas, materiles vegetales en general), que permitan un excelente mantenimiento de los terrenos con el fin de sembrar nuevos cosechas, esta inversión apoyara a sus proyectos de nuevas fuentes de ingresos, que favorezcan a su economía familiar.
texts.en:
José Leoncio is 55 years old, and married. His wife dedicates herself to farming and sales, and her income helps support the household. They have 4 grown children who help out with the farm-related tasks. For 20 years, they have dedicated themselves to the work of harvesting crops. Their short-term plans include diversifying the types of crops they grow, and switch to others that have a high rate of consumption. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural products (fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, and other general items) that would allow them to maintain their lands and plant new crops. This investment would support their intent to find new sources of income, which will favorably support the household.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products (fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, and other general farming products).

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: Née en 1963 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, E. Céline est mariée à BONI Rogatien et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Céline s'est installée depuis seize ans au quartier Yagbé à Cotonou, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Céline n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Céline vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, détergeants, lait, etc.) par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire, Céline vend des tissus. Céline s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Céline exerce cette activité depuis une douzaine d'année et a déjà bénéficié de trois prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Céline sollicite un quatrième prêt pour rehausser son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Céline E. is married to Rogatien BONI and is the mother of four children, all attending (or having attended) school. Céline settled 16 years ago in the Yagbé borough of Cotonou, where she lives with her husband and children. The couple handles together all family expenses. Céline has not attended school. To meet her needs and those of her family, she sells various products (pasta, detergent, milk, etc.) through the distribution system. As a side business, she also sells clothing fabrics. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Céline has been in business for a dozen years now, and has already benefited from three loans, all repaid in full. Facing increasing customer demand, she is now requesting a fourth loan to bolster her business and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cartons of pasta, milk and detergent

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel H. y su esposo el señor José Manuel Bernal tienen una linda familia de dos pequeños hijos, a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor.
En este momento están pasando por un momento difícil tiene un familiar enfermo y quieren ayudarlo pero como no cuentan con el dinero. 
 Es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo y así poder ayudar a su familiar en estos momentos tan difíciles.
Planea pagar el préstamo con el sueldo que obtiene de su trabajo en una fabrica en el área de producción ya que si esposo el señor José Manuel se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad de una compañía.
texts.en:
Ms. Isabel H. and her husband, Mr. José Manuel Bernal, have a beautiful family of two little children, for whom they wish to provide the best. At the moment, they are having a difficult time. They have a sick family member and they want to help him, but they don't have the money. It's because of this that they are asking for a loan, to be able to help their family in these difficult times. She plans to repay the loan with the earnings she obtains from her work in a factory in the area. Her husband, Mr. Jose Manuel, will be in charge of the their household expenses with the income he obtains from his work as a security guard for a company.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Confines Del Sur Group

texts.en:
This loan group is called “Confines del Sur”, and this is the second time it has requested a loan from Kiva.  The members live in Temuco, and they operate a range of businesses that include hair-cutting salons and sale of food products such as prepared lunches, empanadas (filled pastries, which are either sweet or savory), clothing, perfumes, lotions and small gifts.

We talked to Katherine, who is the secretary.  (In the photo she is in the center of the back row in a purple sweater.) She runs a bookstore out of her home, where she sells school supplies and offers photocopying and printing services.  She also has two computers for clients to use, one of which has an internet connection. She will use her portion of the loan to buy notebooks, pens, and reams of paper to sell to her customers. Katherine’s dream is to expand her business into the upper floor of her home, and she is currently working with the municipality to get the permits needed to make this happen. One reason why she works so hard is to provide for her three children, who are 13, 12, and five years old. Katherine enjoys working with Fondo Esperanza because of the trust the organization has had in her, as seen in its willingness to give her a loan with minimal prerequisites.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometres south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lakeside spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

Versión en español:

 Este banco comunal es llamado “Confines del Sur” y es la 2º vez que se publica en el sitio de Kiva. Estos socios pertenecen a la ciudad de Temuco. Ellos se dedican principalmente a negocios tales como venta de almuerzos, empanadas, ropa, perfumes, cremas, cuartillos y peluquería.
La socia entrevistada fue Katherine, quien es la secretaria de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra en la última fila, al centro y viste un suéter morado. Ella tiene en su casa una librería, en donde vende artículos escolares, saca fotocopias e impresiones y además cuenta con 2 computadores, de los cuales  1 de ellos tiene Internet,. 
Invertirá este préstamo en cuadernos, lápices y resmas.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio en un 2º piso, para lo cual está gestionando en la municipalidad para por permisos correspondientes.
Su gran motivación son sus 3 hijos de 13, 12 y 5 años.
Lo que más le ha gustado a Katherine de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es la confianza que han puesto en ella, ya que le piden muy pocos requisitos para darle los préstamos..

loans.use: To buy supplies for a bookstore and other small businesses

loans.name: Los Angelitos Group

texts.es:
Los Angelitos está conformado por tres jovenes trabajadoras una de ellas es María F. L. quien tiene una venta desde hace dos años y comercializa cosméticos. El sueño de ella es tener un tramo en el mercado oriental objetivo que lograra gracias a su trabajo arduo.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Martha H. quien vende ropa nueva y usada en su casa y Gloria C. tiene una pequeña venta de gaseosas y chiverias desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
Los Angelitos is made up of three young workers. On of these women is María F. who has been selling cosmetics for two years now. Her dream is to have a lot in the Eastern Market that she has earned thanks to hard work. The other group members are Martha H. who sells new and used clothing from her house and Gloria C. who has a small stand selling sodas and snacks, which she has been doing for four years

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying basic grain, meat, and cosmetics

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa de sus suegros. Hace mas de 10 años se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de Internet, para ello cuenta con cabinas instaladas en un local que alquiló dentro de su mima comunidad. Debido a la creciente demanda de sus clientes, entre ellos, niños y adolescente, ofrece video juegos también. Adicionalmente a este servicio, ofrece productos comestibles y dulces, que sus clientes consumen mientras están haciendo uso del Internet. Su ritmo de trabajo es todos los días y por lo mismo requiere estar siempre pendiente de su negocio, en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de su suegra. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo, además le es rentable y por ello espera dar mantenimiento a sus equipos y renovar otros. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y asegura ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de golosinas al por mayor y también en la remodelación de sus cabinas.
texts.en:
Claudia is 34 years old and lives with her husband and son in her in-law’s home. For the past 10 years, she has dedicated herself to providing Internet services. To do this, she installed cubicles in a location she rented within her very own community. Given the growing demand from her customers, children and teenagers among them, she also offers video games. In addition to this service, she offers food items and candy that her customers consume while using the Internet. She works every day, as she must always tend to her enterprise, and she occasionally gets help from her mother-in-law. She enjoys her work very much and, as it is profitable, she hopes to maintain her equipment and refurbish others. This is her sixth credit with MFP and she assures us she will be very responsible with her payments. In addition, she thinks this support will be very useful in helping her business progress. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy snacks at wholesale and also to remodel her cubicles.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy snacks and to remodel the Internet cubicles she has.

loans.name: Fali

texts.en: This lady was born in Sokode, Togo, in 1962. She is married with one child, and her husband works as a chauffeur. Since 2000, she has run a restaurant where she makes and serves rice dishes. She has requested her first microloan from Kiva partner, WAGES, of 200,000 XOF. With it, she will purchase rice and beans to supply her restaurant's menu.

loans.use: To purchase rice and beans

loans.name: Fibiana

texts.es:
Fibiana tiene 2 hijos que estudian y es casada, tiene un taller de tejidos de chompas y buzos, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, hijo y tiene un empleado, negocio que inicio hace 4 años, empezó con la venta de comida en el mercado de abastos, actividad que dejo de realizar porque es muy forzado. Con su nuevo negocio sus ingresos son mayores y menos forzado, sus ventas los realiza al por mayor y menor, viaja a las diferentes ferias 4 veces por semana.
Fibiana pertenece al Banco Comunal Flor de Coral y solicita un préstamo de 300 soles dinero que será invertido para la compra de lana, liga.
Fibiana sueña con educar a sus hijos y aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Fibiana is married and has two children, who are students. She has a knitwear workshop, which she runs with the help of her husband, son, and one employee. She started in business four years ago, selling food in the central market, but she gave this up because the work was too difficult. With her new business, her income is higher and easier to obtain. She sells wholesale and retail and travels to different markets four times a week. Fibiana is part of the Flor de Coral Community Bank and is asking for a loan of 300 soles ($125) to invest in buying wool and elastic tape. Fibiana wants to give her children an education and to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and elastic tape

loans.name: Attila

texts.en:
Attila is a businessman from Beregovo who runs a souvenir sales business. He is a skilled craftsman who carves unique souvenirs out of wood for retail sale among tourists. Attila has been in this business for three years and currently makes about 1,500 UAH net profit each month.
Attila is seeking a loan of 6,500 UAH to purchase a house for his family. He has made some savings but needs additional lending assistance to achieve his goal. He doesn’t have a workshop and is therefore hoping to use one of the rooms in his new private house for that purpose. Attila is very diligent and focused. He strives to see his business flourish so that it will bring him a consistent income in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a house

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 estudian, vive en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Huatatas en donde siembran flores, papa, arveja, cuenta con 1 hectárea de terreno, sus ventas los realiza en un mercado cercano a su casa. Además Gloria se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuy, gallina, los cuales son vendidos en los restaurantes. 
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono para sembrar papa. 
Los sueños de Gloria son educar a sus hijos y sembrar en mayor extensión de terreno.
texts.en:
Gloria along with her husband is a farmer. She has 6 children, 5 of whom are in school. She lives in the community of Santa Rosa de Huatatas where they plant flowers, potatoes, and peas on one hector of land. They sell their harvest at a market close to their house. Furthermore, Gloria raises small animals like Guinea pigs and chickens that she sells to restaurants.

Gloria needs a loan of 1050 Peruvian soles to invest in buying fertilizer to plant potato. Gloria's dream is to educate her children and plant a greater area of land.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer to plant potatoes

loans.name: Chérifath

texts.fr: Née en 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, H. Chérifath est mariée à METONOU Raphiou et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Chérifath habite depuis dix huit ans, le quartier N'Vènamédé à Cotonou, avec son mari et ses enfants. Chérifath vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Chérifath n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et contribuer aux dépenses familiales, Chérifath vend des fruits et légumes (mangues, bananes, pommes de terre, carottes, concombre, papaye, beterave, feuilles de laitue, oeufs, etc.) à Cotonou. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Chérifath achète ses produits. Chérifath exerce cette activité depuis vingt ans et a déjà obtenu six crédits auprès de AlIDé. Chérifath  est une bonne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, pour mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle, Chérifath sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Chérifath H. is married to Raphiou METONOU and is the mother of four children, all attending (or having attended) school. Chérifath has lived for the past 18 years in the N'Vènamédé borough of Cotonou with her husband and children. She helps her husband and handles jointly with him all family expenses. Chérifath has not attended school. To meet her needs and contribute to family expenses, she sells fruit and vegetables (mangoes, bananas, potatoes, carrots, cucumbers, papayas, beets, lettuce, eggs, etc.) in Cotonou. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Chérifath has been in business for 20 years now, and has already benefited from six loans with ALIDé. She is a good client of ALIDé’s, who readily reimburses her loans. Wanting to strengthen her business and increase her stock of supplies to meet customer demand, she is now requesting another loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of fruit and vegetables, and cartons of eggs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian y 1 es pequeño aun, viven en la casa de sus suegros. Victoria empezó con la venta de verduras que traía de la ciudad de Lima, negocio que dejo de realizar por su embarazo y hace 2 semanas implemento una tienda en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes. Además Victoria tiene 2 mototaxis con lo que trabaja su esposo y el otro con un chofer. 
Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal Flor de Coral y solicita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de detergentes y para la reparación de sus motos.
Victoria sueña con construir su casa, mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a lively 33 year old woman with three children, two of whom are studying and one of whom is very small. She lives with her in-laws. Victoria began by selling vegetables that she brought from Lima, but she stopped this when she became pregnant. Two weeks ago, she opened a general store, selling meat and vegetables. In addition, she has two motortaxis, one of which is driven by her husband and the other by another driver. Victoria is a member of the Flor de Coral Community Bank and is asking for a loan of 1050 soles ($375) to invest in buying detergents and in fixing her motorcycles. Victoria hopes to build a house, to improve her business, and to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy detergents and to fix her motorcycles

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 52 años, es casada y tuvo 2 hijos que ya tienen familia, Isabel viven la comunidad D. Huarcas, Provincia D. Vilcashuaman, se ubica a 5 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Isabel junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en donD. venden abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Ayacucho a donD. viaja cada 15 días. Además Isabel se dedica a la crianza D. animales como cuy, gallina, conejo, los cuales los comercializa en la misma comunidad.
Isabel necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
Isabel is 52 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She lives in Huarcas, Vilcashuaman Province, which is five hours from the city of Ayacucho. Isabel and her husband have a store, where they sell a variety of goods, including vegetables and meat. They get their products by traveling to Ayacucho every two weeks. In addition, Isabel raises animals, such as guinea pigs, hens, and rabbits, which she sells locally. Isabel needs a loan of 1500 soles ($525) to buy rice and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married and has a 12-year-old daughter. He is a businessman from Berdyansk. Alexander sells plumbing equipment in one of the local marketplaces in his home town. He has many loyal clients and potential customers as his good quality inventory comes at affordable prices. Alexander has unique advertising techniques which helps him to keep his business sustainable. He launched his enterprise 10 years ago. Presently, Alexander has about 50,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. His income amounts to 17,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Alexander is requesting a 20,000 Grivnya loan to increase assorted merchandise for further retail sale in his vending kiosk. Alexander is a born entrepreneur capable of coping with economic challenges and routine struggles every businessman faces each day. His customers characterize him as a businessman of integrity which is a valuable asset these days.

loans.use: To increase amounts of assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Nelson Gustavo

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelson G. de 49 años de edad, es viudo su esposa fallecio hace 1 año, tiene 2 hijas ya señoritas, es mecanico desde muy joven, tiene un taller de reparación y manteniemiento de motocicletas de todas las marcas y modelos, gracias a este trabajo pudo mantener y educar a sus hijas.
El Sr Nelson tiene su taller en su domicilio ubicado en el barrio Azucena de Cnel. Oviedo, donde ademas de las reparaciones de motos de sus clientes,  realiza manteniemiento  por garantias de una empresa de venta de motos reconocida del paiscual es Chacomer.
Solicito apoyo crediticio a la Fundación para la compra de aceite, filtros, corona, cadena, cubiertas, camaras, herramientas, etc para su taller, y asi poder seguir ofreciendo a su amplia clientela un servicio rapido y efectivo.
El Sr Nelson agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo recibido.
texts.en:
Nelson G., 49, is a widower whose wife died a year ago. He has two grown daughters. He has been working as a mechanic since the time he was very young. He has a workshop where he repairs and maintains motorcycles of all models and brands. Thanks to this work he was able to support and educate his daughters. Nelson has his workshop in his home, located in the Azucena neighborhood of Coronel Oviedo. There, in addition to the repairs he makes to the motorcycles of his customers, he also performs warranty repairs for Chacomer, a company that sells motorcycles and is well-known in the country. He requests this loan from the Fundación to buy oil, filters, sprockets, chains, inner tubes, tools, etc. for his workshop. In this way he can continue to offer his large clientele rapid and effective service. Nelson is grateful to the Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva for the support he has received.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tools, headlights, motor oil, spark plugs, etc.

loans.name: Gladys Estela

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Estela S. Q., es joven soltera de 27 años de edad, que habita en el barrio El Rodeo, es agricultora, y fue gracias al apoyo de su padre que le enseño los menesteres de esta actividad y de esta manera ganarse el sustento diario.

Dentro de los planes principales que tiene para su finca, esta la construcción de una pila receptora de agua que le permita almacenar para los días en donde no abastece el vital liquido en la región y no afecte sus cultivos,ni su vida cotidiana, ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas, que permitan un mantenimiento a los terrenos y la garantía de una mejor producción, que aumente los volúmenes de venta y permita la inversión para la cimentación de la pila de agua y el mejoramiento continuo de sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Gladys Estela S. Q. is a young, single 27-year old, who lives in the El Rodeo neighborhood. She is a farmer and, thanks to her father who taught her the tasks related to this activity, she earns her daily living in this manner. Among the primary plans she has for her farm is the construction of a water tank. This would allow her to store this vital liquid for use on her crops when there is not enough of it in her region so that her harvests, and her daily sustenance, won’t be negatively affected. She requests the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides that would allow her to maintain her lands and guarantee a higher level of production from her crops. This would increase the volume of her sales, allowing her to invest in a base for the water tank and the continued improvement of her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es enfermera técnica, tiene 28 años y una hija de 10 años, Carmen vive en la selva ayacuchana en donde tiene su casa y vende abarrotes en general al por mayor, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Ayacucho a donde viaja todas las semanas. Además Carmen se dedica a la compra de café y cacao que luego transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho para comercializarlo. También tiene panales de abejas de la cual obtiene miel de abeja, inicio con 20 cajones y actualmente tiene 42 panales, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Carmen solicita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que invertirá en la compra de cajones de abejas y ceras.
Los sueños de Carmen son cambiar su negocio e implementar una farmacia y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Carmen is a technical nurse. She is 28 years old and has a 10-year-old daughter. Carmen lives in the Ayacuchana jungle where she has a house and sells wholesale groceries. She travels weekly to Ayacuchayo to buy her products. She also buys coffee and cocoa in her local area, which she then transports, to Ayacuchayo to sell. In addition, Carmen has beehives for the production of honey. She started with 20 hives and now has 42. She also sells this product in Ayacuchayo. The purpose of this loan is to buy more hives and beeswax. Carmen’s dream for the future is to change profession and open a pharmacy. She also dreams that her daughter will become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bee hives and beeswax

loans.name: Manfredo

texts.es:
Manfredo es socio del Banco Comunal Flor de Coral, Manfredo es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo de 3 años, Manfredo tiene una mototaxi con la cual realiza transporte urbano en la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Manfredo necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su mototaxi. Lo que mas le agrada de su Banco Comunal son las charlas que recibe y el crédito fácil.
Manfredo sueña con comprar maquinaria pesada para alquilar y trabajar, que su hijo sea profesional y progresar.
texts.en:
Manfredo is a member of the Flor de Coral communal bank. He is 29 years old, lives with a partner, and has one 3-year-old son. Manuel runs a taxi business in the city of Ayacucho with his mototaxi. He works every day. Manfredo needs a loan of 1050 soles to invest in repairs of his mototaxi. What he most appreciates about his communal bank are the workshops and the ease of borrowing. Manfredo dreams of buying heavy equipment to rent and to work with. He also hopes that his son will become a professional and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of mototaxi

loans.name: María Natividad

texts.es:
María Natividad tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente, vive en el caserío San José del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito conformado por varios caseríos considerados como zonas rurales que distan mucho uno del otro. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de quince años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Ella cría aves de corral y ovejas en corrales ubicados cerca de su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un nivel adecuado de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona adquiriendo animales para venderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Esta actividad es su unica fuente de ingresos por lo que da siempre lo mejor de si para mantener su negocio.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales para criarlos y también con la compra de alimento balanceado para que se desarrollen rápida y correctamente. Para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer honesta, sencilla y con muchas ganas de trabajar por el bienestar de su hijo. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle la posibilidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Natividad is 53 years old. She is a single mother, and she has one dependent child. She lives in the San José settlement in the Mórrope district. The district is comprised of various settlements, which are rural zones that are far from each other. It is part of the Lambayeque district, and it is one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has been raising and selling small farm animals for over 15 years. She raises poultry and sheep in corrals that are close to her house. When the animals have grown enough she sells them to the business people who often visit the area to get animals to sell in the city of Chiclayo. This activity is her only source of income, and that is why she always gives her best to maintain her business. María wishes to expland her business by purchasing more animals to raise. She will also buy nutritionally balanced feed so that the animals develop rapidly and correctly. To achieve her goal she is asking, for the first time, Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 700 PEN. María is an honest and unassuming woman. She has a great deal of desire to work for the well being of her child. Her greatest aspiration is to provide him with the possibility of having a better quality of life.
