Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals and nutritionally balanced feed to expand her business of raising and selling animals

loans.name: Obéissance Plus Group

texts.en:
Tshibangu is the leader of the Community Bank named “Obéissance Plus” which means “Obedience” in English. It is composed of 25 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Tshibangu is 50 years old and a father of nine children. He has been active in his business since 1988. He began his business selling watches. Besides selling watches, He also sells miscellaneous goods. He joined one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) in 2009, and has received four loans. Thanks to Hope’s loans, Tshibangu’s business has prospered and it generates a profit of $20 per day. Tshibangu intends with the next loan to diversify his business by buying jewellery to retail at a profit in order to increase his capital. His ambition is to convert into the medical field. Due to the high demand in medicine in his environment, Tshibangu wants to open a drugstore to meet the people’s needs. He works hard in order to achieve his dream.

loans.use: To increase the stock of his goods by buying jewellery and watches and reselling them at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ana Narcisa

texts.es:
Ana de 42 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran  (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución), su esposo es obrero con el tiene tres hijos. Ana es distribuidora de agua en el sector por donde vive debido a que no hay alcantarillado y las personas necesitan de agua limpia y pura para tomar. 

Ella entrega a domicilio los botellones de agua, cada botellón lo vende a $ 1.00. Trabaja todos los días en un triciclo reparte los botellones de agua a las casas del sector. Con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrinas para ya vender los botellones desde su casa. 

En el futuro quiere tener una tienda con todo tipo de víveres.
texts.en:
Ana, 42, lives in Primavera de Duran (an area on the outskirts of the city that originally had an irregular landscape, with several hills, streams, and lakes that still appear as remains of a dissolving ecology). Her husband is a worker, and they have three kids together. Ana distributes water in the area where she lives because there is not a water system set up, and people need clean and pure water to drink. She delivers large bottles of water to people's homes. Each large bottle costs $1. She works every day on a rickshaw to deliver the bottles to the homes in her area. With this loan, she wants to buy display cases to sell the bottles from her home. In the future, she would like to have a store with all kinds of supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Display cases, large bottles of water

loans.name: Patricia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Patricia del Socorro M. F., es casada de 31 años dedicada desde hace 20 años a la agricultura, su esposo labora como albañil, y tienen un hijo de 8 años que estudia la escuela secundaria, ellos habitan en el barrio San Francisco.
Dentro de las mayores necesidades que tiene la familia está el mejoramiento a la infraestructura de su hogar, tras sus años de experiencia considera nuevamente que sus terrenos necesitan de un mantenimiento que permita mejorar la producción, es por esta razón que solicitan vuelven a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, tales como fertilizantes y fungicidas, que aporten al buen crecimiento de las cosechas, un aumento en el volumen de ventas, y les favorezca sus recursos económicos para la inversión a su hogar en las remodelaciones que se necesitan llevar a cabo ya que amenazan con la estabilidad y seguridad familiar.
texts.en:
Patricia del Socorro M. F. is married and 31 years of age. For the past 20 years, she has dedicated herself to farming. Her husband works in construction. They have one son who is 8 years old, and attends the secondary school. They live in the San Francisco neighborhood. Among the family’s primary needs is the improvement of the infrastructure of their home. Over her years of experience, she considers that her lands need maintenance that will allow for a better level of production. For this reason, she returns to request a loan to buy agricultural products such as fertilizers and fungicides. This will allow her harvests to grow, therefore augmenting her sales, which will favorably impact her financial resources. The income would allow her to make the renovations her home needs, as its disrepair threatens the family’s stability and security.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the maintenance of her farmlands.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 44 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Son 5 años que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, asimismo se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando principalmente papa y en ocasiones maíz y alfalfa, siendo éste último para alimentar a sus animales. Durante la temporada de siembra y cosecha,  toda su familia participa de esta tarea, en donde prepararan la tierra y al momento de la recolección de su producción es necesario el contrato de peones que ayuden en la labor. A parte del trabajo agrícola que realiza, también se dedica a la comercialización de sus productos, de esa manera obtiene la ganancias necesarias. Paralelo es este trabajo también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y cada cierto tiempo sus compradores la buscan para obtener estos animales, puesto que ella posee cuyes de buena raza y bien alimentados. Estas actividades le permiten a Gladys  estar en su casa y atender a sus hijos, además que es un gran apoyo para la economía de su hogar. Mas adelante desea  mejorar  la calidad de sus cosechas y abundante. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y por tanto promete en ser puntual con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para comprar sacos de abono y materiales de construcción para la elaboración de galpones para darles mayor espacio a sus cuyes.
texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and 2 children. For 5 years, she has been raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. She also works in agriculture, planting mainly potatoes and sometimes corn and alfalfa, the latter for feeding her animals. During the planting and harvesting seasons, her whole family participates in the work, preparing the soil. When the time comes to harvest, it's necessary to hire workers to help with the work. In addition to the farm work she does, she also sells her products, thus obtaining needed profits. At the same time, she raises guinea pigs and after a certain amount of time, her buyers seek her out to obtain these animals, since she has well bred and well fed guinea pigs. These activities allow Gladys to be in her house and raise her children, and they are a great support for her family's finances. In the future, she wants to improve the quality and quantity of her crops. This is her fourth loan with MFP and therefore she promises to make her payments on time. She also thinks this loan will be very useful to progress her business. With the loan, she will buy sacks of fertilizer and construction materials to make shelters to give her guinea pigs more space.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and construction materials for a guinea pig shelter.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Pablo O. F., tiene 41 años de edad es casado, y padre de 2 hijos adolecentes, la familia habita en el Barrio San Francisco, su esposa es docente y con sus ingresos aporta a la economía del hogar, el señor Pedro es agricultor de yuca, desde hace mas de 21 años, la mitad de su vida se ha dedicado a esta actividad y conoce el manejo de ella misma.

Ellos tienen planeado la adquisición de razas de ganado, para la formación de un ato, e incursionar en la ganadería, otra actividad en la cual se lucra de buena manera, para esto realizara la compra de pastos mejorados, pues planea tener todos los recursos para el ganado una vez que se compren,  pero antes de realizar esta inversión desea adquirir fertilizantes, abono y pesticidas que permitan un mantenimiento correcto para mejorar los niveles de venta y por ende aumentar las ganancia que favorezcan a los planes que la familia se ha trazado, en el pasado Afodenic bajo los fondos Kiva apoyaron al Señor O. y pudo diversificar sus cosechas que le permitieron un aumento en los volúmenes de ventas y ganancias, ahora espera que se le apoye nuevamente para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, en la incursión de nuevas fuentes de ingreso.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo O. F., 41, is married and has 2 teenage children. The family lives in the San Francisco neighbourhood of Managua. His wife is a teacher, and contributes economically to the home. Pedro has been a cassava farmer for over 21 years; half of his life has been dedicated to this activity and he knows it well. They plan to acquire livestock in order to form a herd and get into ranching: another very profitable activity. For this, they will buy improved grazing pastures, and they plan to have every resource needed for their livestock before they buy the animals. Before they do so, they want to buy fertilizers, manure and pesticides which will help increase their sales and allow them to carry out their plan. With a previous loan through Afodenic and Kiva, Pedro was able to diversify his crops and increase his sales and profits. He hopes that he will find more help to improve his family's quality of life through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer, manure and pesticides

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
“Por 15 años fuí presidenta del banco Comunal Mateo Pumacahua”

Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Mateo Pumacahua” de la Asociación Arariwa, es natural de la ciudad Chinchero, tiene 46 años y es soltera.  Actualmente, Victoria cuenta con un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en elaborar y vender artesanía de tipo tejido plano. El proceso que toma en consideración son tres elementos principales: la fibra, hilado y el teñido.  Para el hilado utiliza como elemento principal la lana de camélidos (alpaca) para tejidos finos y lana de llama para los más burdos. Para el teñido de lana se utiliza tintes naturales como la cochinilla, etc. La socia es una tejedora artesanal que utiliza el telar vertical para elaborar sus llikllas (mantas), costales, rebozos, anakus (falda envolvente), ponchos, frazadas, ceñidores (fajas masculinas) y fajas pata (faja para niñas).  Su actividad económica complementaria es vender maíz seco.   

Victoria es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario sacar adelante a sus familiares, ella requiere el préstamo para mejorar la casa y para uso personal. El anhelo de la socia es mejorar su artesanía y desea salir al extranjero para hacer conocer sus productos y dar entender el proceso de la elaboración de la textilería.      

Victoria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
“For 15 years I was president of the Manteo Pumachua Communal Bank.” Victoria belongs to the Mateo Pumachua Communal Bank with the Arariwa Asociación. She is a native of the city of Chinchero. She is 46 years old and single. Victoria currently has a small business. It consists of making and selling plain weave handicrafts. This process has three principle elements to consider; the fiber, the yarn, and the dyeing. For the yarn she uses alpaca wool as the basic element for soft weavings. She uses llama wool for the more coarse weavings. She uses natural dyes like “cochinilla” (insect used to make red dye), etc. to dye the wool. Her weavings are handmade, and she uses the vertical loom to make her “llikllas” (blankets), bags, shawls, “anakus” (wrap around skirt), ponchos, men’s belts, and children’s belts. Her complimentary economic activity is selling dried corn. Victoria is a hard-working and enterprising person who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead. She does this so that, through her daily effort, she can get her family members ahead. She needs the loan to improve her house and for personal use. Her goal is to improve her handicrafts. She wants to go to other countries to have them know her products and have them understand the process of making the textiles. Victoria is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her house and for personal use

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Pablo Antonio L. A., es casado de 39 años de edad, viven en el Barrio de San  Caralampio, tienen 4 hijos adolecentes que apoyan a sus padres en los trabajos del campo, la señora se dedica a las tareas domesticas.

El productor tienen 9 años de experiencia en esta actividad, él se dedica a la siembra de las hortalizas, uno de los problemas que más afectan sus cultivos es la infección de plagas, y robos da la producción, a futuro espera tener los recursos necesarios para diversificar las cosechas por otras que se tengas un alto grado de consumo, èl solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, abonos e insumos vegetativos, que brinden un mantenimiento optimo con el objetivo de mejorar sus cosechas y aumentar los volúmenes de venta, y el mejoramiento continuo de sus niveles de vida. En el pasado Afodenic con el apoyo de Kiva le habrindado un apoyo a sus propósitos y  su progreso ha sido clave motivacional para toda su comunidad.
texts.en:
Pablo Antonio L. A. is 39 years old and married. They live in the San Caralampio neighborhood. They have four adolescent children. They help their parents with the field work. His wife does the domestic chores. The producer has nine years of experience in this activity. He grows vegetables. The problems that affect the crops the most are pest infestation and theft of his crops. In the future, he hopes to have the needed resources to diversify his crops. He wants crops that are consumed a lot. He is requesting a loan to buy natural and chemical fertilizers, fungicides, and vegetative supplies. Using these supplies he will provide optimum maintenance in order to improve his crops and increase the volume of what he sells. Then he will continue to improve their standard of living. In the past Afodenic, with help from Kiva, has given him support for his proposals. His progress has been a key motivational factor for his whole community.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy natural and chemical fertilizers, fungicides, and vegetative supplies in order to provide optimum maintenance to improve his crops

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El señor  Santos C. C.,  es casado de 51 años y con su familia habitan en el Barrio San Ignacio, ella se dedica a la costura, pero apoya a su pareja en los trabajos del campo, debido a que él es agricultor de piña y pitahaya, tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, que trabajan y apoyan a sus padres económicamente y físicamente en los trabajos del hogar y campo, sus hijos viven en el hogar de sus padres, pues sus limitados recursos económicos no les han permitido una mayor  independencia.

El productor tiene más de 28 años de experiencia en este campo, y una de las dificultades que más lo han apremiado, ha sido el robo de las cosechas, situación que atenta con su economía domestica, considera a futuro realizar un estudio de suelos para el mejoramiento continuo de sus cultivos, a futuro espera tener los necesarios para mejorar día a día su negocio, ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas y materiales agronómicos que le favorezcan al buen mantenimiento de sus tierras, con el objetivo de aumentar sus niveles de venta y tras esto mejorar sus condiciones económico sociales.
texts.en:
Santos C. C. is 51 years old, and he is married. He lives with his family in the San Ignacio neighborhood. He wife is a seamstress, but she helps him with the field work. He grows pineapple and dragon fruit. They have three grown children who work and help their parents economically and physically with the household work and the field work. Their children live in their parents’ home. Their limited economic resources do not allow them greater independence. This producer has over 28 years of experience in this field. One of the most pressing difficulties has been the theft of his crops. This situation hurts their domestic economy. He is considering doing a study of the soil in the future. He will do this to continually improve his crops. In the future he hopes to have the necessities in order to improve his business day to day. He is now asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and agricultural materials that will help him provide good maintenance to his fields. His objective is to increase his sales. That way he will improve their socioeconomic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers, pesticides, and agricultural materials that will help him provide good maintenance to his fields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of food products and corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a second-hand car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling food items

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
Carmen L.  convive actualmente con el padre D. sus 5 hijos 3 D. ellos aun menores D. edad, tiene 42 años es una D. las 8 integrantes  del grupo D. Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto  conformado por socios que se dedican a distintas labores.
Carmen  comenzó a vender productos  AVON  (productos D. belleza como son perfumen, talco, colonia, entre otros) tardo aproximadamente 1 año para poder ganar clientes, al transcurrir ese tiempo su ingreso mejoro y con L. necesidad D. poder  comprar más productos para su venta tuvo L. oportunidad D. participar por intermedio D. una amiga  en  Edaprospo, su primer préstamo lo invirtió en L. compra D. más productos  AVON.,  en L. actualidad venD.  comida , golosinas, gaseosas, en un puesto que alquilo dentro D. un Colegio D. Educación,  al igual que todo  negocio  empezó con pequeñas cantidades D. mercadería pero  al poco tiempo su ingreso mejoro  por L. venta regular que obtenía. Este actual préstamo lo invertirá en L. compra D. su mercadería como es  3 cajas D. gaseosas, cajas D. galletas, caramelos, chicles,  embutidos  y cajas D. Yogurt.
Los planes que trae en mente son  D. poder inaugurar un Restaurante en una zona transcurrida por el público  y desD. luego ofrecerle una mejor vida a sus hijos
texts.en:
Carmen L. currently lives with the father of her 5 children, 3 of whom are still minors. She is 42 years old and is one of 8 members of the Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto group comprised of members that engage in various types of work. Carmen began selling AVON products (beauty products such as perfume, talcum powder and cologne). It took approximately 1 year for her to gain customers, during which time her income improved, and needing to buy products to sell, she had the opportunity to participate for the first time in Edaprospo, through a friend. She invested her first loan in buying more AVON products. She now sells food, sweets and sodas at a place she rented in a College of Education. Like with all business, she started with small quantities of merchandise, but her income soon improved due to regular sales. This current loan will be invested in the purchasing of merchandise: 3 cases of soda, boxes of cookies, candy, gum, sausages and boxes of yogurt. She has in mind plans to open a restaurant in an area where the public passes by and of course to offer a better life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 3 cases of soda, cookies, candy, sausages and yogurt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Buena Vecindad Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres Buena Vecindad, se conformó en fecha 26 de setiembre del 2006, actualmente, se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto,  ya se encuentran  en el 13º ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El grupo en el transcurso de los ciclos, no tuvo inconvenientes   gracias a su trabajo solidario lograron salir adelante y siguen trabajando con el programa hasta estos días. 
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario y en  equipo admirable. 
Una de las integrantes Daniela quien se dedica a la venta comestibles salados y dulces que ella misma prepara y los ofrece recorriendo varios lugares.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comestibles como carne, huevo, aceite, condimentos, harina, etc.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Buena Vecindad Communal Bank was founded on September 26th, 2006. They are currently enjoying working in their 13th cycle. They are working together in a supportive way in the program. In the course of their cycles they have not had any difficulties. Thanks to their supportive work they have gotten ahead. They continue working in the program. They actively participate in weekly meetings. Their work is supportive, and they are an admirable team. One of the members, Daniela, sells sweet and salty food. She prepares the food herself, and she sells it by going to different places. She is requesting a loan to buy the ingredients to make her food. She will buy things like meat, eggs, oil, condiments, and flour, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, oil, condiments, dairy products, meat, flour, and eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of sewing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on and sell cassava flour

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado T. tiene 64 años de edad, está casado con  DelRosario Denis, tienen 3 hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes. 
Viven en una compañía muy conocida de la ciudad de Itá, donde poseen una despensa bien surtida hace mas de 30 años de donde provee a vecinos y amigos de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar como: carne, verduras, leche, carbón, bebidas en general, embutidos y otras mercaderías. Además alquila varias hectáreas de tierra donde realiza plantación de caña dulce hace varios años. 
El señor Amado solicita el préstamo para la compra de diversos tipos de mercaderías para la despensa como: harina, arroz, fideo, azúcar, bebidas, etc. a modo de aumentar su stock de mercaderías y pueda generar mayores ingresos familiares y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Amado T. is 64 and is married to Del Rosario Denis. They have three adult children who live independently. They live in a well-known area in the city of Itá, where they have owned a well-stocked grocery store for more than 30 years. He provides his friends and neighbors all kinds of basic supplies for the home like: meat, vegetables, charcoal, beverages, sausages, and other merchandise. He also rents several hectares of land where he has grown sugar cane for several years. Señor Amado is requesting this loan to buy different kinds of merchandise for his store like: flour, rice, noodles, sugar, drinks, etc. In this way, he can increase his stock of merchandise and will be able to earn more income for his family and will improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, rice, noodles, sugar, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Auxiliadora María

texts.en:
Auxiliadora is a 24-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Turrialba, Cartago, a tranquil mountainous region located near the Central Valley of Costa Rica. Auxiliadora lives with her sister and mother in an annex of the store which the family has been renting over the past 2 months. Auxiliadora and her 21-year-old sister, Angelica, have 5 years of experience managing  a store in San Jose; however, they have recently moved to Turrialba as a result of the separation of their mother and father. 

The sisters have been working tirelessly from 5:30 AM to 7:00 PM Monday to Sunday in their new store to get it off the ground. Auxiliadora says her sister is better with numbers, so Angelica does all the calculations and determines the prices of products. Although this loan is in Auxiliadora´s name, the two really work as a team, and Angelica will have significant input into how this loan will be used (especially since she´s so good with numbers).

In their store, the sisters offer everyday products that you might find at your average corner store: instant soups, potato chips, juices, ice cream, kitchen appliances and milk, among other products. As you can see in the picture, inventory levels are low. Auxiliadora and her sister plan to use this loan to invest in more inventory and also to purchase a fridge to keep refreshments cool. 

Auxiliadora´s short-term goal is to make the store more profitable, increase income and improve living conditions for her family. The income generated from the store's sales combines with the monthly salary that her mother earns as a domestic worker, which amounts to 90,000 colones (180 USD,) as the family's only sources of income. Rent is 30,000 colones per month, not including electricity and water costs. With respect to the store, Auxiliadora hopes to earn enough profits in order to one day be able to purchase the store and the house the family is currently renting (the house and store are attached). 

Both Auxiliadora and her sister are taking night classes, 3 hours every day, in order to complete high school. When they aren´t busy managing their store, they do their homework. The sisters hope to graduate from high school within the next 3 years. Angelica mentioned she would like to go on to university and study accounting.

Auxiliadora and her family face some challenges. The rent payments have become difficult to make, as a result of low sales levels as of late. Auxiliadora is confident that this loan will give her the injection of working capital she needs to turn the store into a better income-generating activity. Another obstacle has been local groups who attempt to break in and rob the store at night. The sisters don´t seem deterred by the robbers, though. Auxiliadora says ¨we have 2 dogs and an alarm, and the police come if the alarm goes off.¨

When asked if they enjoy this type of work, the sisters both replied yes. Angelica says, ¨it´s better to work for ourselves.¨

loans.use: To purchase a fridge and inventory items

loans.name: Luis Albeto

texts.es:
Luis de 30 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran  (con varios cerros y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución), su esposa es ama de casa tienen dos hijos de 8 y 3 años. Cuando Luis era pequeño el papa tenia una carnicería y todos sus hermanos trabajaban con el. Como era un negocio familiar todos aprendieron administrar la carnicería, cuando crecieron todos sus hermanos invirtieron sus ahorros en carnes para vender, incluyéndolo a el.

 Ahora la carnicería es su primer ingreso para su familia, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00pm, vende la libra de carne a $ 2.20, chancho a $ 2.00,etc. Pero para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos el quiere construir mejor su casa comprando hierro y cemento para la construcción. 

En el futuro quiere comprar maquinas cortadoras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is 30, and he lives in the Primavera de Duran (an area with some hills and lakes that still show signs of ecological dissolution) with his wife, who works at home, and their two children, 8 and 3. When Luis was young, his father had a butcher shop and all the sisters and brothers worked there. Since it was a family business, they all learned how to manage a it. When they all grew up, they, including Luis, invested their savings in meat to sell. Now the butcher shop is the main income for his family. He works there from 7 am until 8 pm, selling beef by the pound at $2.20, pork at $2.00. But to give a better life to his children he wants to build his house better, buying iron and cement for the construction. In the future we wants to buy meat cutting machines for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Iron, cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To refurbish her restaurant

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
Benedicta P. de 46 años, es presidenta de la Asociación Comunal San Juan, que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana. Benedicta se dedica a vender  verduras en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, una de ellas es el mercado San Felipe, ella vende hace 5 años aproximadamente por la necesidad de solventar los gastos de su familia el cual está conformado por 11 integrantes.

Benedicta necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería y seguir generando ingresos. También indica que a ella le gusta la forma de trabajo que se tiene en Pro Mujer, sobre todo el ahorro, además visita con relativa frecuencia al consultorio porque le dan un trato caluroso.

Las demás integrantes de esta Asociación Comunal tienen variados negocios que se dedican al comercio, producción y servicio, todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Benedicta P. is 46 years old and the president of the San Juan Communal Association which is part of the Centro Focal Panamericana. Benedicta sells vegetables in different markets around the city of El Alto. One of these markets is the Mercado San Felipe. Due to the necessity of paying for family expenses, she has been selling at markets for approximately the past 5 years. Her family consists of 11 people. Benedicta requires the loan in order to acquire merchandise and continue to generate income. She also indicates that she likes the type of work that they have to do at Pro Mujer , especially the savings. In addition, she regularly visits the consulting office because they treat her so warmly. The women members of this communal association have a variety of businesses, both production-based and service-based. They all require the loan in order to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new sewing machines and supplies for his work

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Comité La Amistad, así se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita el 23 de Junio de 2009.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Es un grupo muy activo y el trabajo solidario se nota en cada una de sus integrantes, ya  que todas ellas a parte de ser compañeras en el Comité son muy buenas amigas.
Una de las señoras muy sacrificadas es Doña Eleuteria quien después de procurar bastante logró montar su negocio vendiendo todo tipo de artículos necesarios para la casa.
A parte de su despensa ella prepara dulce y masa para vender, y sus hijos le ayudan para la atención del negocio.
Ella agradece a todas las personas que de alguna manera ayuda para que ellas pueda trabajar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, panificados, lácteos  y otros.
texts.en:
La Amistad group is the name of a group of women that was formed in the city of Ita on June 23, 2009. All of the members carry out activities for raising money, and all of them help each other to reach their common objectives within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya. The group is very active and each of the members shows strong group solidarity, since in addition to being part of the group, all of the members are also good friends. One of the women is Eleuteria. She is very selfless, and after saving enough money she started her business selling all types of household necessities. In addition to her store, she also makes cake and pastries to sell. Her children help her attend to her business. Eleuteria is grateful to all of the people who have helped in some way so that she and her friends can work. She is asking for the loan so that she can purchase rice, sugar, noodles, canned foods, baked goods, dairy products, and other items for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing canned foods, dairy products, vegetables, fruits, meat, eggs, cleaning supplies, plumbing supplies, cosmetics, etc. at wholesale prices to sell at retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her cultivable land and purchase new yam shoots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cultivable land and purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cultivable land and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase her cultivable land and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertiliser and extend the area of arable land

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is a married father with a 5-year-old child. Yuryi offers ceremonial services and sells ceremonial inventory in his home town. He has been in this business for 5 years. His turnover capital is about 30,000 UAH and his net profit exceeds 5,000 Grivnas a month. One of the specific characteristics of his business is high turn-around of inventory.

Yuryi is very focused and determined. He is grateful for the loans he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” which have helped the expansion of his business. Today, Yuryi is requesting a loan of 12,500 UAH to purchase additional raw materials to manufacture funeral wreaths, e.g. sham flowers, wire and ribbons. The loan will be beneficial for Yuryi’s business by keeping it competitive and promoting further growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase the area of available arable land and buy agricultural products

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre La Esperanza, se conformó en fecha 17 de agosto del 2006.
El grupo tienen un excelente comportamiento de pago, y el trato entre ellas es memorable, gracias a esto y a su trabajo solidario siguen  adelante incrementando sus ingresos y  trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
Una de las integrantes es la señora quien se dedica a la venta de miel, ella trabaja elaborando miel de caña de azúcar, tiene un aparato manual con que exprime la caña obteniendo primeramente el mosto que también puede ser consumido, luego este se hierve a altas temperaturas obteniendo la miel.
Una que ella ya tiene la miel lo envasa en diferentes tamaños para vender, ella ofrece y vende sus productos a varios negocios de la zona.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de frascos, caña de azúcar y otros.
texts.en:
The La Esperanza women's committee was created on August 17, 2006. They have an excellent record for payment, and their treatment of each other is noteworthy. Because of this and their solidarity, they continue to increase their investments and are still working together. One of the members sells honey. She produces sugar cane honey with a manual machine with which she wrings the cane and extracts juice which can also be consumed. Later this is boiled at high temperatures to create the honey. Once she has the honey, she jars it in various sizes to sell. She sells her products at various businesses in the area. She will use the loan to buy jars, sugar cane and other necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials such as sugar cane, flour, sugar and coal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase the area of arable land and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cecilia Del Rosario

texts.es: La Señora Cecilia Del Rosario tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 1 depende de ella, por lo que no es la primera experiencia que tiene con créditos. Su actividad económica es la de venta de comida hace más de 21 años, ella dio inicio por cuenta propia pues necesitaba mantener una fuente de ingreso necesaria para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar materia prima como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, frutas y verduras. Ella es una persona que se ha sacrificado bastante por lo que sueña que su hija se haga cargo del negocio en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cecilia Del Rosario has six children, one of whom is still dependant on her, which is one of the reasons why this is not her first experience with microcredit loans. She has sold food for more than 21 years. She began doing so on her own account because she needed a stable income to support her family. Currently, she is requesting a loan for working capital that will buy ingredients like rice, sugar, oil, beans, fruits and vegetables. She has sacrificed a lot to see her dream, that her daughter will take over the business in the future, come true.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: plow the field, expand the area of arable land, buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Angela Felicitas

texts.es: Ángela Felicita tiene 77 años. La actividad económica a la que Ángela se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 31 años que se dedica a este negocio.  Esta no es la primera vez que tiene experiencia con financiamientos pues ha demostrado ser una persona responsable. Por lo que tiene muchas energías y muchos clientes que asisten a su negocio pues para ella es muy importante. Es por este motivo que realiza este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar gaseosas, jugos, rosquillas, pan y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Ángela Felicita is 77 years old. She runs a local store, which she has been doing for 31 years. This is not her first experience with microcredit loans and has shown herself to be a responsible person. She is very energetic and has many customers who come to her store, which is very important to her. This is why her microcredit loan will be used to buy items such as sodas, juices, rosquillas (a type of doughnut), bread and basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: extend the area of arable land and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Semilla Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Panamericana, se reúne la Asociación Comunal SEMILLA.
Su presidenta es la señora Mercedes T. de 42 años, se dedica a tejer mantas hace 12 años, al inicio solo se dedicaba al hilado pero con el pasar del tiempo incursionó en el tejido con el préstamo que esta solicitando ella tiene planificado comprar lana y producir más prendas.
Las demás integrantes de ésta Asociación tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de pollos, costura de buzos, venta de ropa, venta de comida y carne, todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan
texts.en:
The association SEMILLS meets in one of the centers of Pro Mujer Panamericana. Their president is Mrs. Mercedes T., who is 42 years old. She has been making traditional woven cloths for 12 years. At first she only spun the yarn, but with time she began to weave as well. With this mircocredit loan, she plans on buying wool to make more cloth. The other members of the association specialize in various things such as selling chickens, sewing sweatshirts, selling clothes, selling food and meat, but all of them need the loan in order to acquire more merchandise, supplies or prime materials, depending on their speciality.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase prime materials

loans.name: Elia Maria

texts.es: Elia Maria tiene 69 años, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues siempre ha presentado mucho interés en mejorar los gastos de su familia. Ella dio inicio por iniciativa propia, pues con mucho empeño ha demostrado ser una excelente cliente. Ella está solicitando este crédito para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima como maíz, cal y comal. Su deseo es mejorar su vivienda, pues así podrá ofrecerles a sus hijas un porvenir.
texts.en:
Elia Maria is 69 years old, and her main economic activity is the production and sale of tortillas. She has been in this business for more than 6 years, as she has always had a keen interest in improving her family's economic situation. She launched her business on her own initiative, and with a lot of effort she has demonstrated herself to be an excellent client. She is requesting this loan for working capital that will be used to purchase raw materials such as corn, lime and a griddle. Her main wish is to improve her home; in this way she would be able to offer her daughters a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy corn, lime and a griddle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying manure and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying manure and other farm supplies

loans.name: Miriam Alexandra

texts.es:
Miriam de 36 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos, ella tiene una distribuidora de waype (lo utilizan los albañiles con diluyente para quitar las manchas de pintura), por la falta de oportunidades Miriam empezó recolectando retazos y telas para elaborar los waype. 

Reparte a las ferreterías (almacén de venta de artículos de construcción) en todo Guayaquil, los waype los elabora con telas y retazos de tela, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00pm. La libra de waype la vende a $ 1.50. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas para los waype, en el futuro quiere tener un almacen de waype.
texts.en:
Miriam, 36, lives in the urban Orquídeas neighborhood of the city of Guayaquil. She has 3 children, and is a distributor of "waype," (waste cloth used for cleaning), which is used by bricklayers with thinner to remove paint stains. Lacking job opportunities, Miriam began gathering scraps and fabrics to make the waype. She distributes her product to the hardware stores (stores selling construction products) in all of Guayaquil. She makes the waype with fabrics and scraps of fabric, working from 7am until 10pm. She sells a pound of waype for $1.50. With the loan she wants to buy fabric for the waype. In the future she wants to have a waype store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric and fabric remnants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: plough the field and buy fertilizer

loans.name: 17 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Panamericana, se reúne la Asociación Comunal 17 OCTUBRE, con 11 integrantes 
Una de las integrantes y presidenta  es Petronila A., de 49 años administra una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, cuenta con éste negocio hace 15 años el mismo le ha generado ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia ya que cuenta con 3 hijos, Petronila necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, específicamente tarjetas para llamadas.  
Las demás integrantes de éste grupo cuentan con diversos negocios como la venta de pescado, tejido de manoplas, taller de bicicletas, costura de prendas de vestir, tejido de mantas, elaboración de pan, venta de zapatos y venta de ropa,  necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
In one of the central offices of “Pro Mujer Panamericana”, the 11 members of the communal association "17 Octubre" met. One of the members, and also the president, is Petronila A.. She is 49 years old and the administrator of a neighborhood store located within her home. She has owned this business for the past 15 years. The store has given her the income to cover the family expenses for her 3 children. Petronila requires the loan in order to acquire merchandise, specifically calling cards. The women members of this group have a variety of businesses: selling fish, knitting mittens, repairing bicycles, sewing articles of clothing, knitting blankets, making bread, selling shoes and selling clothing. They need the loan in order to acquire merchandise or raw materials according to which business they have.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es: Samuel Antonio tiene 48 años, tiene 2 hijos que están a su cargo. La actividad económica de Samuel es brindar el servicio de video juegos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esto pues la necesidad de tener un trabajo estable y generar una fuente de ingresos para su familia es muy importante, por lo que la necesidad de tener su propio negocio en su casa tambien el vende bolsitas en su vivienda para su pequeños clientes, fue la mejor idea para Samuel. El financiamiento es para la compra de equipos discos, repuestos y piezas para los videos juegos.
texts.en:
Samuel Antonio is 48 years old and is responsible for 2 children. Samuel owns a video game store. He has been doing this for the past 6 years. It was very important to have stable work and generate a source of income for his family. For this reason, he has his own business in his house. He also sells little bags of frozen sweets out of his home for his young customers. The loan is to buy equipment such as disks, replacements and parts for the video games.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Bricy Lorena

texts.es:
Bricy es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace más de un año a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Tiene una tienda que funciona en la casa donde vive actualmente. Ella nos cuenta que la idea del negocio partió de su suegra y de la necesidad de contar con una fuente permanente de ingresos que sirva para solventar los gastos familiares ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero eventual y también manejando mototaxis (motocicletas que tienen una cabina anexa, utilizadas en el transporte de carga y pasajeros).

Sus vecinos siempre acuden a su establecimiento para agenciarse de sus productos rápidamente pues el mercado queda lejos de la zona en donde vive. La asidua clientela que frecuenta su negocio ha hecho que Bricy piense en ampliarlo con la compra de más productos. Por este motivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Anteriormente Bricy ya ha trabajado con el Fondo Kiva, gracias a la colaboración de sus prestamistas hizo que comprara bebidas en la temporada pasada de verano. Ella es una madre emprendedora, resposable y muy trabajadora. Ella sueña con tener una casa propia ya que actualmente vive en casa de su suegra
texts.en:
Bricy is a 29 year old mother who lives with her husband and their two children in Paiján district, in the province of Ascope, in the region of La Libertad which is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For over one year, she has sold basic necessities and groceries. She has a small store out of the home where she is currently living. She tells us that the idea for the business came from her mother-in-law, who realized the necessity of having a permanent source of income in order to pay the family expenses. Her husband is a temporary laborer and also drives “mototaxis” (motorcycles that have a small cab attached used to transport both cargo and passengers). Their neighbors always come to their establishment in order to get a hold of products quickly as the market is located far from the area where they live. The regular customers who come to their business have forced Bricy to think about expanding and buying more products. For this reason, she is soliciting a loan of 1000 Nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Bricy has worked with the Kiva foundation before. Thanks to the collaboration of the loan officers, she was able to buy drinks last summer. She is an enterprising mother, responsible and very hard working. She dreams of owning her own home as currently she is living in her mother-in-laws house.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic necessities and groceries in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora P. Montiel es  una señora de 23 años de edad la cual vive con su abuelita en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Aurora se ha destacado por ser siempre una  joven muy emprendedora.  Desde hace algunos años inicio su propio negocio una pulpería (tiendita de abarrotes) para vender productos básicos a sus vecinos en su propia casa; con este negocio ha logrado tener  una actividad económica rentable que la ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida y mantener a su abuela quien a sido su madre y padre toda la vida.

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢654.000(seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro  mil colones) para comprar los materiales necesarios para ampliar su local y así poderle brindar una mejor atención  a sus clientes. Ella comenta que el servicio que ella brinda es muy importante ya que tienen muchos clientes y por eso necesita más espacio.
texts.en:
Aurora P. Montiel is a 23 year-old woman who lives with her grandmother in a community called Hernández in Los Chiles, in the Alajuela province. This is a community that is known for its mountainous areas and beautiful countryside; it is quite humid and is located along the highway that runs very close to the country’s northern border. Its main commercial activities are livestock production and farming, specifically staple grains, tubers and oranges. Aurora has stood out because she has always been a very enterprising young person. A few years ago she started her own grocery store business (a small grocery store) selling basic products to her neighbors from her own home. With this business she has managed to have a profitable economic activity that helps her to improve her quality of life and support her grandmother, who has been her mother and father all of her life. Currently she needs a loan of 654,000 Costa Rican colones to buy materials needed to expand her store, so that she can provide better service to her customers. She comments that the service that she provides is very important, since she has a lot of customers and so needs more space.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and expand her store

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Kennedy Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Las Emprendedoras Kennedy, se conformo en fecha 25 de setiembre del 2.009.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Blanca quien se dedica a la venta de frutas, ella posee un puesto de venta en el mercado donde debe ir muy temprano para vender sus productos. 
Ella además de vender frutas actualmente también quiere ofrecer en su puesto verduras, ella  solicita el préstamo para la compra de verduras como cebolla, tomates, pimientos, manzana, naranjas y otros.
texts.en:
This committee of women is named “Las Emprendedoras Kennedy” (The Kennedy Entrepreneurs) and was established on September 25, 2009. They all participate in fundraising activities and help each other meet the goals they have in common with one another and with Fundación Paraguaya. One of the members is Sra. Blanca who sells fruit. She has a vending post at the market where she arrives early to sell her products. In addition to fruit, Blanca wants to start offering vegetables from her stand. She is requesting a loan to buy produce such as onions, tomatoes, peppers, apples, oranges, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa que fue heredada por parte de sus padres. Hace mas de 3 años vende fruta y lo realiza de acuerdo al tiempo en que hay ciertas frutas,  siendo éstas adquiridas en la zona selva, en donde compra por camionadas las frutas, entre ellas: naranjas, chapanas, plátanos, papayas y que son muy solicitadas por lo gente. Cada semana realiza la venta, distribuyendo a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son comerciantes minoristas de fruta y se encuentran en distintos puntos de la ciudad. Por lo general al comprar la fruta al por mayor lo adquiere en su etapa previa de maduración, es por ello que cuenta con un almacén en su casa  tiene  un almacén donde hace madurara las frutas y así garantiza la calidad de sus productos que satisface a sus clientes, este negocio le ha resultado beneficiosa por lo que desea tener mas capital de trabajo y tener mas clientela. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y por tanto promete en ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además confía que este aporte le será de mucho beneficio para el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de fruta al por mayor.
texts.en:
Lida, 32, lives with her husband and their 2 children in the house inherited from their parents. She has sold fruit for more than 3 years, selling according to the seasons of various fruits. She obtains them from tropical regions, purchasing shipments of oranges, chapanas, bananas, and papayas, which are very popular with people. Each week she completes the sale, distributing to her clients which are mainly small fruitsellers found in various areas of the city. In general she buys pre-mature wholesale fruit, so she has a warehouse in her house where the fruits can mature, thus guaranteeing a product quality satisfactory to her clients. This business has been beneficial, so she wants to increase her working capital to gain more clients. This is her third loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She is confident that this contribution will greatly benefit the progress of her business. She will invest this loan to purchase more wholesale fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale fruit

loans.name: Jeanette De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jeanette De Los Ángeles tiene 40 años, tiene 3 hijos que todavía están bajo su cargo. Empezó a ser comerciante desde muy joven ya que toda su familia es comerciante ella también quiso ser igual y tener sus propios ingresos. Invirtió en ciertos productos como ropa, calzado, cosméticos entre otras cosas, siempre le ha gustado ofrecer a sus clientes una amplia variedad de productos. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en este negocio y esto le ha ayudado en su vida personal. El financiamiento es para la compra de productos varios, por lo que ya tiene algunos pedidos. Su deseo es terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jeanette De Los Ángeles is 40 years old and has three dependent children. As a young woman, she began working as a merchant since everyone else in her family was in the same line of work and had their own businesses. She invested in certain products such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other items. Jeanette always enjoys offering her customers a wide variety of products. She has plenty of experience in this business which has been a great help in her personal life.

This loan will be used to buy various products to fulfill a few existing orders. She hopes to finish the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy a variety of merchandise

loans.name: Creativas 1,2,3,4 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of her group Las creativas (The Creative Ones), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and four children.

Maritza is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small grocery store business by purchasing rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, flour, soups, spices, vegetables and a freezer. She will use the profits to save money for completing renovations to her home and to eventually buy a car to move her goods around more easily. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and a freezer for her business

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer es un excelente grupo, que trabaja en forma solidaria, todas las integrantes asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para el bien común del grupo.
Una de las señoras es Doña Daniela quien es costurera, ella confecciona varios tipos de prendas para damas y caballeros. 
Ella hace las confecciones de acuerdo a los pedidos de los clientes quienes llegan hasta su casa para la solitar su confección. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser eléctrico con varias funciones.
texts.en:
“Renacer” (Rebirth) is the name of this excellent solidarity group. All of the members attend the weekly meetings and participate in activities for the common good of the group.

One of the members is Doña Daniela, who works as a seamstress. She makes various types of clothes for women and men. The clothing she produces is designed according to the requests of her customers who come to her house to place their orders. She is requesting a loan to buy an electric sewing machine with various functions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 46 años, su actividad económica es la una pulpería. Por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperación de mantener a su familia, decidió invertir todos sus ahorros en este negocio que actualmente es que le está generando el pan de cada día a ella y su familia por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de superarse y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Así la ubicación de su actividad es en su vivienda en donde es visitada por vecinos, amigos y compañeros. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina is 46 years old and manages her own store. Out of desperation to support her family due to the lack of opportunities, she decided to invest all of her savings into this business which now generates daily income for her and her family. Rosa is always looking for ways to overcome so that her children can get ahead. She operates her business out of her home, which is frequented by neighbors, friends, and colleagues. Rosa dreams of improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maritza Del Camen

texts.es: La señora Maritza tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, de los cuales solamente uno es menor de edad y el otro tiene 19 años, pero ambos están a su cargo. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada, pero principalmente vende cosméticos y joyas de plata, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante. Ella ya tiene más de 12 años de dedicarse a este negocio, cabe señalar que empezó vendiendo ropa usada en su casa, después fue que invirtió en cosméticos comprándole a la Vogue y a la Zermat ambas casas comerciales que distribuyen cosméticos y cuando tenía buen capital empezó a invertirle al negocio de joyas de plata. Posee buena clientela y generalmente de sus ventas, las personas le pagan el 50% al momento de la compra y el oro 50% se lo pagan en un mes. El crédito será invertido en la compra de joyas de plata principalmente, además que desea prepararse desde antes a la fecha que se acerca de la celebración del día de la madre. Su sueño siempre ha sido tener una tienda grande que sea atendida por ella y sus hijos, y poder construir un nuevo cuarto en su casa para que sus hijos vivan más cómodos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maritza is 42 years old, married, and has two children. The older child is 19 years old and the younger one is still a minor, but both are still financially dependent on her. Maritza has a business selling used clothing, but she primarily sells cosmetics and silver jewelry as a traveling vendor. She has been in this business for more than 12 years. It should be noted that she began selling used clothing from her home, but she later invested in the purchase of cosmetics from commercial distributors such as Vogue and Zermatt. When she built up a decent amount of capital, she began investing in silver jewelry.

Maritza has a good customer base and generally good sales. Her customers pay half at the time of purchase and the other half within a month. This loan will be invested primarily in silver jewelry, but she also wants to be prepared before the arrival of Mother’s Day. Her dream has always been to have a large store that she and her children can manage. She also wants to build a new room in her house so that her children can live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy silver jewelry

loans.name: José De La Rosa

texts.es:
José de la Rosa es un padre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a un hijo en el caserío El Carrizo del distrito de Mochumí, un distrito netamente agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a mas de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría cerdos cerca a su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los vende en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Como esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos cuida de brindarle a sus animales una buena alimentación, por ello siempre los alimenta con polvillo, granos, alimento balanceado y pastos naturales.

Adicionalmente José trabaja como albañil, pero esta actividad solo le brinda ingresos eventuales. El desea adquirir nuevos animales para criarlos y también alimento balanceado para mejorar su calidad y así percibir mayores ingresos. Por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

José es un padre honrado y que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia. En la zona donde vive le consideran una persona muy trabajadora y humilde.
texts.en:
José de la Rosa is a 44 year old father who lives with his wife and son in the village of El Carrizo in Mochumí, a purely agricultural district that is part of Lambayeque Province. The district is located more than 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

José has been raising and selling animals for more than ten years. He raises pigs near his house and when they are fully developed he sells them at the Moshoqueque Market in the city of Chiclayo. Since this business is his main source of income, he takes care of his animals by providing them a good diet. He always feeds them ground meal, grains, balanced feed, and natural grasses.

José also works as a mason, but this activity only provides incidental income. He wants to acquire new animals to raise and buy balanced feed to improve their quality so that he will receive more income. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

José is a father who is honest and always looks for ways to move his family forward. In the area where he lives, he is considered to be a hardworking and humble person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals & feed

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Hace mas de 9 años se dedica a trabajar de manera independiente en la venta de prendas de vestir para todas las edades, en donde sus clientes adquieren el producto a crédito y luego de un tiempo, previamente acordado, Lidia se dispone a realizar la cobranzas de casa en casa. Generalmente su trabajo lo realiza en la mañana o de acuerdo al tiempo que tiene su clientela. Por otro lado ofrece productos de belleza, de esa manera complementa parte del negocio que tiene, además que es un ingreso más. La mercadería que tiene lo adquiere al por mayor en las fabricas de ropa de su ciudad y en ocasiones, de acuerdo al pedido, viaja a Lima para comprarlos en cantidad y a un bajo precio. El negocio que ha elegido lo considera rentable es por ello que anhela adquirir más prendas de vestir. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y por tanto asegura ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas,, además confía que este aporte le será de mucha ayuda para su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de casacas al por mayor, por tener mucha demanda en temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Lidia, 32, lives with her husband and her son in their own home. She has worked independently selling clothing for all ages for more than 9 years. In her business she gives credit to her customers, and later, at a time previously agreed upon, she collects the funds door to door. She usually does this work in the mornings, or according to her customer's schedules. She also offers beauty products for sale, which complements her other business and provides for additional income. She acquires her merchandise at wholesale from the factories that make clothing in her city, and occasionally, on the basis of an order, she travels to Lima to buy clothes in quantity and at a low price. She views the business that she has chosen as profitable, and so she wants to acquire more garments to sell. This is her 6th loan with MFP, so she assures us that she will be responsible in making her payments. In addition, she trusts that this support will help her a lot with her business. With the loan requested, she will buy winter jackets at wholesale, because there is a lot of demand for them during the winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy winter jackets at wholesale

loans.name: Maria Montiel

texts.es:
Maria Montiel C. es una señora de 51 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Doña María inicio su negocio hace poco más de dos años. Ella tiene una panadería, dice que sus productos son muy aceptados en su comunidad ya que son muy buenos y de gran calidad, además comenta que está muy feliz de poder tener un negocio propio en su casa así puede estar al cuidado de sus hijos y no dejar de lado las tareas del hogar y  que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.
En estos momentos doña María del Carmen desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢654,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro  mil colones), para comprar otro  horno industrial, una batidora industrial y diferentes materiales necesarios para elaboración de sus productos. Con esta inversión  espera incrementar la producción para atraer más clientes, ofrecer un mejor servicio y así hacer que su negocio crezca más y lograr ser una microempresaria exitosa. 

Doña Maria es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Maria Montiel C. is a 51 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children in the community of Hernández, located in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. This community is in a mountainous area known for its great landscapes, high humidity, and its location along the highway near the northern border of the country. The main business activities of the region are livestock breeding and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of basic grains, tubers, and oranges.

Doña María started her business a little more than two years ago. She has a bakery and says that her products are well-received in her community because they are very good and of high quality. Maria also claims that she is very happy to have her own business in her home because she is able to look after her children and not have to set aside her household chores. Thanks to her business, her living conditions and that of her family have improved considerably. In addition, Maria indicates that she has grown as a person and has gained much knowledge.

At the moment, Doña María wants to obtain a microloan in the amount of 654,000 CRC (six hundred fifty-four thousand Costa Rican colones) in order to buy another industrial oven, an industrial mixer, and different ingredients for making her products. With this investment, she hopes to increase her production so that she can attract more customers, offer better service, grow her business, and become a successful micro-entrepreneur.

Doña María is a member of the United for Development Community Credit Enterprise, one of the 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes to grow personally and financially. She also wishes to express her thanks for these types of organizations and credit facilitators that dedicate most of their time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven, an industrial mixer, and different ingredients for producing baked goods

loans.name: En Nombre De Jesus Group

texts.es: Johana Maria, Margarita y Johana conforman el grupo Solidario En Nombre De Jesús. Por lo que juntas forman un excelente grupo pues son personas muy responsables y humildes. Cada una de ellas se dedica a diferentes actividades económicas. Johana Maria se dedica a la venta de leña y frijoles en su humilde vivienda, la mayoría de sus clientes le tienen un gran cariño, pues ella además de ser muy inteligente con su negocio ha sabido aconsejar a sus clientes que algunas veces recurren a su negocio. Ahora juntas las 3 deciden realizar un financiamiento que será destinado para la compra de materia prima para la compra variada de sus productos. Sueñan con seguir adelante y proporcionar a sus familias lo más necesario.
texts.en:
Johana Maria, Margarita, and Johana are the members of the solidarity group “En Nombre de Jesús” (In the Name of Jesus). Together they make an excellent group because they are responsible and humble people. Each is engaged in a different business activity.

Johana Maria sells firewood and beans from her modest home. She has great affection for the majority of her customers. In addition to being very smart about her business, she also provides advice to her customers that they can use in their own businesses.

At the moment, these three individuals have decided to apply for a loan that will be used to buy raw materials and a variety of products. They dream of moving forward so that they can provide for the needs of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy materials & various products

loans.name: San Cayetano Ii Group

texts.es:
Todas las integrantes de este comité se encuentran muy satisfechas con las actividades que realizan cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Domitila quien después de integrar el comité comenzó con la actividad de venta de ropas.
Ella tiene un salón en su casa donde con la ayuda de su hija atiende a los clientes quienes llegan hasta la tienda para comprar las ropas que ella ofrece.
 Ella desea ampliar su salón, y actualmente con la temporada fría que llega al país quiere contar con ropas abrigadas como camperas, suerte, conjuntos, pantalones, poleras, y otros.
texts.en:
All of the members of this committee are very satisfied with each of their business activities. One of the members is Sra. Domitila who began selling clothes after joining the committee. She has a store set up in her house. Her daughter helps attend to her customers who come to her store to buy the clothes she offers. Domitila wants to expand her space. Now that the cold season is arriving in the country, she wants to buy warm clothing such as jackets, sweaters, winter outfits, trousers, pullovers, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Virginia, Nuestra socia tiene 18 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y vive con su pareja desde hace  1 año; Nuestra socia se dedica a la agricultura como actividad principal y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, Nuestra socia está aprendiendo en sus ratos libres hacer pulseras con lanas de diversas texturas y colores y los diferentes motivos; Nuestra socia también cría gallinas y pollitos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar junto con su conyugue una vaquita tierna.

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Virginia belongs to the Colquecancha community bank; she lives in the Raqchi community, Urubamba, Cusco. She is 18 and has lived with her partner for 1 year. Her primary activity is agriculture, and her partner is a farmer and rancher. In her free time, she is learning to make bracelets in different motifs with wool of various textures and colours. She also raises little hens and chickens. She is requesting this loan to buy a young cow with her partner. She is grateful to all the investors who are making this dream possible, and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Maria Bellaluz

texts.es:
La señora Maria Bellaluz M. ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntualmente.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para impermeabilizar el techo de su casa ya que esta en muy mal estado y quiere repararlo antes de que se llegue la temporada de lluvias.
Porque tiene tres hijos pequeños y no quiere que se le enfermen. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo de limpieza de una casa en la vecina ciudad. 
Ya que su esposo el señor Fernando Martinez se encargara de los gastos familiares, con el sueldo que recibe como policía escolar de la ciudad
La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor Fernando Martinez esposo del señora Maria Bellaluz.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Bellaluz M. has already taken four previous loans with FVP, all of which were repaid on time. She is requesting a loan to weatherproof the roof of her house because it is in bad condition and needs to be repaired before the rainy season arrives. Maria has three small children and does not want them get sick. She plans to repay the loan using the income she earns cleaning houses in the neighboring city. Her husband, Sr. Fernando Martinez, takes care of the family expenses with the salary he receives working for the city as a school police officer.

The person who appears in the photo is Sr. Fernando Martinez, the husband of Sra. Maria Bellaluz.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repairs

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Francisca, Nuestra socia tiene 47 años de edad, la socia es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en la universidad y ella los apoya económicamente; Nuestra socia se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, como cuyes, chanchos y aves de corral, la socia también tiene ovejitas, Nuestra socia es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, la socia misma se encarga de buscar a sus compradores para cuando es la época de cosecha, ella compra las semillas de papa, maíz y algunas hortalizas las mismas que son sembradas en su terreno, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para pagar las mensualidades de sus hijos en la universidad hasta que ella venda su maíz y papa. 

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the Colquecancha community bank; she lives in the Raqchi community, Urubamba, Cusco. She is 47, divorced, and has 2 children who are in university; she supports them economically. She is a farmer and grows small animals, such as guinea pigs, pigs and fowl. She also has lambs. She is a very enterprising and hard-working woman, and she is already looking for her purchasers who will buy her products at harvest time. She is buying seeds for potato, corn and other vegetables that are already sown in her land. She is requesting this loan to pay the university instalments for her children until she can sell her corn and potatoes. She is grateful to all the investors who are making this dream possible and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University tuition for 2 children

loans.name: Merida

texts.es: Mérida tiene  46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos  en una casa alquilada. Hace mas D. un año decidió vender ropa usada, que es adquirida en la ciudad D. Lima y en ocasiones lo consigue en su misma ciudad. Su rutina diaria es salir a vender durante las mañanas la mercadería que tiene a la clientela que transita cerca D. su puesto. Procura siempre D. ofrecer prendas en buen estado, que le permitan una venta segura.
