Su trabajo es muy gratificante, puesto que son muchas las personas que no tiene la oportunidad D. conseguir un prenda nueva, además su esposo la ayuda en el negocio, consiguiendo más ropa que vender. Por tal motivo desea conseguir abasteciéndose D. esta mercadería para aumentar sus ingresos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y por tanto promete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además confía que este aporte le será D. mucho beneficio para desarrollarse como comerciante. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería en prendas D. vestir para incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Merida is 46 and lives with her husband and 2 children in a rented home. Over a year ago she decided to sell used clothing, which she acquires in Lima and, sometimes, in her own city. Her daily routine consists of leaving in the morning to sell her merchandise to customers who pass by. She always offers clothing in good condition, and this ensures a good transaction. Her work is very gratifying; many people don't have the opportunity to buy new clothing. Merida's husband helps her with the business, collecting more clothing to sell. Merida wants to continue stocking more clothing in order to increase their income. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she promises to repay it on time. She is confident that this will be very beneficial to her development as a merchant. With the requested loan, she will buy more used clothing merchandise in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Luz marina, Nuestra socia tiene 26 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 2 menores hijos, Nuestra socia alterna sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista y la artesanía, la socia junto a su esposo tienen un pequeño terreno de cultivo de maíz y papa, ella vende los productos secos y también se dedica a hacer a mano con lanas de colores pulseras con diseños andinos y recrea toda la iconografía Inka; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar sus materiales y parte de ello para comprar aves de corral. 

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz Marina belongs to the Colquecancha community bank; she lives in the Raqchi community, Urubamba, Cusco. She is 26, married, and has 2 young children. She does housework, retail and handicrafts, and she and her husband own a small plot of land where they grow corn and potatoes. She sells these products and also makes handmade bracelets with Andean designs and Incan iconography. Luz Marina is requesting this loan to buy materials and barnyard birds. She is grateful to all of the investors who are making this dream possible, and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Craft materials and barnyard fowl

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
El señor Margarito U. y la señora Leonor Villegas son padres de familia y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad y a quienes les quieren dar  los estudios necesarios para que tengan un mejor futuro. 
Solicitan el préstamo ya que tiene gastos de la escuela de sus hijos y no cuentan con el dinero necesario para que puedan terminar el año escolar.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de carga.
texts.en:
Mr. Margarito U. and Mrs. Leonor Villegas are parents and have three children under their care. They hope to provide for the necessary studies so their children can have a better future. They are soliciting a loan for school expenses for their children as they don’t have the money needed for them to finish off the school year. They plan to pay off the loan with a portion of the earnings that he earns from his work as a cargo truck driver.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: school expenses

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre San Roque, se conformo en fecha 29 D. octubre del 2008.
Se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4º ciclo en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Es un grupo que se destaca por trabajo en conjunto y solidario que realizan.
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Eva quien se dedica  a la venta D. comestibles como empanadas, chipas, sopas, empanada D. mandioca, y otros.
Ella se levanta muy temprano para elaborar sus comestibles y como a las 6 D. la mañana se traslada hasta el centro D. la ciudad para la venta D. sus comestibles, ella ya cuenta con clientes seguros quienes todos los días compran sus productos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra D. ingredientes como carne, huevos, leches, masas, harinas, condimentos entre otros.
texts.en:
The San Roque women's loan group was formed on Oct. 29, 2008. The members are very comfortable working together on their fourth loan cycle with the program. It is a group that stands out for its teamwork and solidarity. One of the members is Eva, who makes a living selling food such as empanadas, chips, soups and other items. She gets up very early to make her foods and by 6 a.m. she travels to the city center to sell the items. She has regular customers who purchase her products every day. She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients such as meat, eggs, milk, dough, flour, condiments and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase canned foods, meat, eggs, flour, noodles, oil, vegetables, condiments, bread products

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Nazaria, Nuestra socia tiene 53 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Nuestra socia alterna sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista la socia compra y vende productos agrícolas en Urubamba y Cusco; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar al por mayor productos agrícolas que escasean en esta época. 

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nazaria belongs to the Colquecancha community bank; she lives in the Raqchi community, Urubamba, Cusco. She is 53, married and has 3 children. She does housework and retail; she buys and sells agricultural products in Urubamba and Cusco. She is requesting this loan to buy wholesale agricultural products that are becoming scarce. Nazaria is grateful to all of the investors who are making this dream possible, and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of scarce agricultural products

loans.name: María Albertina

texts.es:
María Albertina tiene 49 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el sector Cruz del Médano, uno D. los caseríos mas grandes del distrito D. Mórrope, caracterizado por tener a la mayoría D. su población agrupada en zonas rurales que distan mucho una D. la otra. Pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercio D. animales menores desD. hace mas D. tres años. Ella cría aves D. corral y ovejas en corrales ubicados cerca D. su domicilio, les brinda una alimentación balanceada y cuando estos ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona con cierta frecuencia para adquirir animales que luego venderán en el mercado Moshoqueque D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

María trata D. mantener su negocio para seguir percibiendo ingresos que le permitan ayudar a su esposo con la economía familiar. Actualmente ella desea adquirir mas animales para criarlos y venderlos, así como alimento balanceado para mejorar su calidad y percibir mas ganancias, siguiendo su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer activa que comparte su tiempo entre las actividades D. ama D. casa y en el cuidado D. sus animales. Su mayor anhelo es contribuir al mejoramiento D. la calidad D. vida D. su familia. En la zona donD. vive sus vecinos la estiman mucho y la consideran una mujer responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
María Albertina is 49 years old, married and has two children. They live together as a family in Cruz del Médano, one of the largest hamlets in the district of Mórrope, which is known for having the majority of its population clustered in rural areas very distant from one another. María lives about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo in the province of Lambayeqye. She has maD. a living raising and selling small animals for more than three years. She raises poultry and sheep in pens near her home, providing them a balanced diet, and when they have reached a good level of development she puts them up for sale to the business people who visit the area with some frequency to acquire animals to then sell in the Moshoqueque market in Chiclayo. María tries to keep her business going so she can continue earning income to help her husband with the family finances. Currently, she wishes to acquire more animals to raise for sale, as well as balanced feed to improve their quality and increase their value, which is why for the first time she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. María is an active women who divides her time between her household chores and caring for her animals. Her biggest goal is to contribute to the improvement of her family's quality of life. She is held in high esteem by her neighbors in the area and they consider her a responsible and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals and feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Alejandra, Nuestra socia tiene 39 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, Nuestra socia teje a mano con sus dedos pulseras y compra algunas artesanías de Pisac para venderlos en el mirador de Raqchi, la socia aprovecha que en el mirador de Raqchi paran los turistas para tomar fotos y observar el bellísimo paisaje del valle de los Inkas. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y un poco de artesanía también ayudará en la casa en algunos gastos caseros.

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alejandra belongs to the Colquecancha community bank; she lives in the Raqchi community, Urubamba, Cusco. She is 39, lives with her partner and has 5 children. She does housework and craftwork; she weaves bracelets by hand and buys crafts from Pisac to sell in the Raqchi viewpoint. She takes advantage of the fact that tourists stop in the overlook to take photos and admire the beautiful countryside of the Incan valley. Alejandra is requesting this loan to buy materials and some crafts, and also to help with some household expenses. She is grateful to all the investors who are making this dream possible, and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Craft materials and household expenses

loans.name: Iván

texts.es:
El señor Iván G. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual  pudo realizar la mejora a su casa.
Esta solicitando nuevamente otro préstamo para terminar su casa ya que le están haciendo falta algunos detalles de los acabados y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica en el área de asistente de mecánica. 
Las personas que aparecen en la foto son la señora Blanca Esthela Garcia y dos de sus hijos ya que el señor Iván se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Iván is grateful for Kiva's help with his previous loan that allowed him to make improvements to his home. He is requesting another loan to complete his house since it is lacking a few finishing touches and at the moment he doesn't have the necessary funds to be able to purchase the material and pay for someone to carry out the work. He plans to repay the loan with money he earns from his job at a local factory as a mechanics assistant. The people who appear in the photo are his wife Blanca Esthela Garcia and two of their children since Iván was a work on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the exterior of his home

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Elena  soltera  de 37 años de edad es comerciante. Tiene un negocio de venta de ropas en el mercado municipal de la Ciudad de Itá. 
 Comenta que empezó trabajando  hace más de 3 años, y que anteriormente estuvo trabajando en costura, con lo que fue consiguiendo de a poco el capital para abrir su negocio.  Actualmente cuenta con variedad de mercaderías con que trabaja día a día  para sacar adelante a toda su familia.  
Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya y en Kiva y solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías, ya que actualmente por la estación está contando con una gran demanda de prendas para invierno (camperas y busos).
El Sra. Elena agradece el préstamo recibido ya que gracias  a ello pudo cumplir con todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elena is 37 years old, single and makes a living as a merchant. She has a business selling clothes at the municipal market in the city of Itá. She says she started the business more than three years ago and that she previously worked in sewing, and used the little capital she made to start her business. Currently, she has a variety of merchandise she works with day to day to make headway for all of her family. She has decided to turn to Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya and request a loan to purchase more merchandise because demand is high right now for winter clothing (jackets and sweaters) because of the season. Elena is thankful for the loan because it allows her to satisfy all her customers' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jackets, pants, sweaters, jumpsuits, jeans

loans.name: Janneth Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Janneth T. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de la Bahía, vive en la ciudad de Azogues esta localidad  se caracteriza por ser la capital de la provincia del Cañar, su clima es frió y  su gente se dedica a varias actividades como es la agricultura, albañilería, artesanías etc., y muchos de ellos han migrado a las ciudades principales del país o al exterior en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades

Nuestra socia tiene 42 años de edad, se encuentra casada y tiene cuatro  hijos que se encuentran de 20, 13, 12, y 6 años,  su primer hijo se encuentra cursando los estudios superiores, los otros dos hijos se encuentran en el colegio y su último hijo estudia en la escuela de la localidad, su esposo trabaja como empleado público y gracias al  trabajo mututo cuenta con su casa propia.

Janneth se dedica al comercio vende ropa para toda la familia,  actividad que realiza durante varios años de lunes a sábado, se encuentra en su segundo crédito siendo estos invertidos en  la ampliación de su negocio y fue incentivada a formar parte de éste hermoso grupo de mujeres trabajadoras  por sus amigas comerciantes. Con el dinero que reciba comprará pantalones, camisas, blusas, sacos, vestidos, ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños

Su meta es llegar a tener un puesto propio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Janneth T. is a member of the community bank Mujeres de la Bahia. She lies in the city of Azogues, the capital of the Canar province. Its climate is cold and its people work in various sectors such as agriculture, bricklaying and crafts. Many of them have migrated to larger cities or to other countries to look for better opportunities. Janneth is 42, married and has four children ages 20, 13, 12 and 6. Her eldest child is in college, the middle children are in high school and the youngest attends the local primary school. Her husband is a public employee, and thanks to his income, they have their own home. Janneth sells clothing for all ages, an activity she has done for many years, from Monday to Saturday. This is her second loan, and she has been investing in expanding her business. She was motivated by her friends to join this beautiful group of hard-working women. With this loan, she will buy pants, shirts, blouses, jackets, dresses, and underwear for men, women and children. Her goal is to have her own stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Yamilka Xiomara

texts.es: Yamilka Xiomara tiene 27 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que dio inicio a esta actividad, por lo que empezó como muy pocos productos, con el fin de ayudar con los gastos familiares y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos. Empezó con capital propio pues ella necesitaba tener un medio de vida, todos los días alista su canasta para salir a vender a sus clientes. Por lo que el financiamiento es para la compra de cremas, pinturas, colonias, perfumes, tratamientos y lápiz labial. Desea tener su tienda en donde pueda tener una amplia variedad para ofrecer.
texts.en:
Yamilka is 27 years old and makes a living selling general merchandise. It's been more than six years since she started the business. She started out with very few products with the goal of helping with the family income and providing her children with a better life. She started the business with her own money because she needed to have a way of life. Every day she fills her basket with items to go out and sell to her customers. She is requesting the loan to purchase lotions, makeup, colognes, perfumes, skin treatments and lipstick. She wishes to have a store where she can offer a wider variety of merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
La señora María Inés González vive en la ciudad de Azogues, localidad que se caracteriza por ser la capital de la provincia del Cañar, su clima es frió favoreciendo al cultivo de frutas y legumbres de ese clima,  su gente se dedica a varias actividades como es la agricultura, albañilería, artesanías etc., y muchos de los más jóvenes han migrado a ciudades mas grandes del país y al exterior para dar a sus familias un presente y futuro mejor.

 María Inés tiene 62 años de edad, casada y madre de seis hijos quienes se encuentran de 42, 38, 36, 30, 27, 23 años, todos son casados y viven de manera independiente, su esposo es de profesión mecánico y con el sacrificio en su hogar han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica al comercio y alquiler de ropa que ella misma confecciona ya que cuenta con un titulo profesional en corte y confección actividad que realiza hace 40 años, labora de domingo a domingo de 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo gracias a la invitación de sus amigas del mercado, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas camisas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos, sacos y tambien tela, hilos, cierres, botones y más articulos para la confección de sus prendas.

Su meta es tener otro puesto para seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
María Inés González lives in the city of Azogues. This location is notable for being the capital of the Cañar province. The cold climate favors fruit and vegetable crops. The people work at various activities like farming, laying bricks, and handicrafts, etc. Many of the younger people have migrated to larger cities in and outside of the country. They have done this to make life for their families better now and in the future. María Inés is 62 years old, married, and has six children. They are 42, 38, 36, 30, 27, and 23 years old. They are all married and living independently. Her husband is a mechanic. With sacrifices at home they were able to build their own house. Our member sells clothes and rents the clothes that she makes. She has a professional certificate as a seamstress, and she has been doing this for forty years. She works Sunday to Sunday from nine in the morning until six in the evening. She is in her third cycle, thanks to the invitation from her friends at the market. She will use the loan to buy more shirts, pants, skirts, dresses, and jackets. She will also buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, and more things for making her outfits. Her goal is to have another stand in order to keep expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shirts, jackets, pants, skirts, dresses, fabric, thread, zippers, buttons and other things.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.es: Sandy tiene 21 años, tiene un hijo recién nacido, comparte su vida a lado de sus padres, viviendo en casa de ellos. Hace mas de 3 años se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, producto que lleva a vender de manera ambulante en las ferias locales de cada zona rural de su ciudad. En ocasiones viaja a otras ciudades de la selva para ofrecer éstas medicinas, que junto a su madre, que siempre la apoya, realizan las ventas y con el tiempo ha logrado tener experiencia y conocer las estrategias para vender al cliente. Asimismo ambos se dedican a buscar nuevos proveedores para que se puedan abastecer de medicinas naturales y a un bajo precio, por ello considera rentable su negocio, porque los productos que vende tienen acogida de los clientes, y por tal anhela tener un puesto estable. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte de su grupo comunal, en donde se compromete a ser muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de productos naturales al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sandy is 21 and has a newborn child. She lives with her parents. For over 3 years she has sold natural medicines, and she travels to local markets in every rural area of her city. Sometimes she travels to other cities in the forest to offer these medicines. She has gained experience and an understanding of good marketing strategies. She and her mother, who always supports her, look for new suppliers in order to stock up on natural medicines at low prices. For this reason, she considers her business to be profitable, because the products she sells are well-recieved by her clients, and she so greatly desires a steady job. This is her first loan with MFP; she was invited to be part of her group, and she promises to be very responsible with her repayments. Sandy is grateful to those who will support her loan and knows it will be very helpful to the growth of her business. With the requested loan, she will invest in the wholesale purchase of natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural products

loans.name: Leyser Alexander

texts.es: Leyser Alexander tiene la actividad económica de brindar el servicio de cantos religiosos. Inicio hace más de 8 años por lo que desde muy joven le gustaba este medio de vida, pues siempre está dispuesto a mejorar y sacar adelante a su familia. Cuando creció no tuvo oportunidad de trabajar y tuvo que practicar lo que su papa le enseño, que es brindar este servicio, el además le ayuda a sus hijos con las tareas de la escuela pues le interesa que sean unos profesionales. El financiamiento es brindarle reparaciones a su unidad de transporte y comprar otros instrumentos. El desea seguir prosperando para mejorar sus condiciones y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leyser Alexander works offering his services in religious song. He began this more than 8 years ago, because he has liked this life from a young age. When he grew up, he did not have the opportunity to work, and he had to practice what his father taught him, which was this service. He also helps his children with their homework at school and would like them to get careers. This loan is to get repairs on his method of transportation and purchase other instruments. He hopes to keep prospering in order to improve his family’s conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alamiro

texts.es:
Alamiro tiene 33 años de edad, es casado, y vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el caserío El Progreso, un sector rural dedicado exclusivamente a la agricultura y a la ganadería, pertenece al distrito de Lagunas y se encuentra  ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace mas de dos años que se dedica a la ganadería, posee cuatro vacas lecheras que cría con mucho esfuerzo, ya que son la única fuente de ingreso económico diario de su familia; la leche producida por sus animales la vende diariamente a una empresa acopiadora de la zona, que le compra el producto a 0,90 nuevos soles el litro.

Alamiro desea comprar alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de su ganado lechero y así percibir mayores ingresos, además planea brindar mantenimiento a un cultivo de maíz chala que planea utilizar en la alimentación de su ganado. Para lograr su meta ha solicitado a Edpyme Altenativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Alamiro es una persona que gusta mucho de las labores que realiza por lo que siempre trata de realizarlas de la mejor manera. Su mayor anhelo es construir una casa de material noble, ya que la que tiene es de adobe y no les ofrece la seguridad necesaria.

Alamiro ya había trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva y se encuentra agradecido porque gracias a la ayuda brindada pudo completar el dinero que necesitaba para adquirir una de las vacas que actualmente posee.
texts.en:
Alamiro is 33 years old, married and lives with his wife and their four children in their farmhouse, El Progreso, a rural sector dedicated to agriculture and livestock in the district of Lagunas that is located forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than two years, he has raised stock. He has four milking cows that he raised with much effort, and now they are the only source of daily income for his family. The milk that his animals produce is sold daily to a local wholesale business, that purchases the products for 0,90 PEN a liter ($.030 USD).

Alamiro wants to purchase a balanced food to improve the production of his dairy farm, and in this way receive a better profit. Also, he plans to maintain a cultivation of corn that he can to use to feed his farm. To achieve his goal, he has asked Edpyme Altenativa for a loan of 1500 PEN ($525 USD).

Almiro is a person who really enjoys his work and always tries to find a better way to do things. His biggest dream is to construct a home of quality materials, since the one he has is made of adobe and doesn’t offer the necessary security.

Alamiro has already worked with Kiva and is grateful because thanks to the support offered, he was able to put together the money to acquire one of the cows that he now owns.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a balanced food and improve the production of his farm

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Sánchez es nuestra socia hace tres ciclos invitada por  su hermana a formar parte del banco comunal Mujeres de la Bahía, vive en la cuidad de Azogues esta ciudad se caracteriza por ser la capital de la provincia del Cañar, su clima es frió es propicio para el cultivo de frutas y legumbres de éste clima,  su gente se dedica a varias actividades como es la agricultura, albañilería, artesanías, entre otras y muchos de ellos han migrado en buca de mejores oportunidades para ellos y sus familias.

Nuestra socia es comerciante de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, esta actividad la realiza hace 35 años ya que cuenta con un puesto propio en un mercado de laciudad, trabaja todos los días sin descansar desde las  7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Doña Rosa tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y ha procreado 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 34, 32 30 y 26 años, sus tres primeros hijos son casados, dos de ellos viven independientes y  una hija casada vive en su casa y compartiendo los  gastos con sus padres y su último hijo que trabaja como guardia y aporta para tambien para la casa,  su esposo le ayuda en el negocio vendiendo la mercadería,  con el esfuerzo en conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

con su credito comprará casacas, pantalones, blusas, camisas, faldas, vestidos, etc.  y seguir surtiendo la ropa para su exigente clientela.

Su meta es incrementar con más mercadería su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Sánchez has been a member of this communal bank for 3 loan cycles. She was invited by her sister to become part of the communal bank "Mujeres de la Bahía." She lives in the city of Azogues, which is the capital of Cañar province, and is known for its colder climate, which is favorable for the production of fruits and vegetables. Its people are engaged in a variety of activities, such as agriculture, masonry, handicrafts, and others, and many of them have migrated in search of better opportunities for themselves and their families. Rosa sells clothing for men, women and children. She has been in this line of work for 35 years, and has her own stall in a market in the city. She works each day without rest from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening. Rose is 54 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 34, 32, 30 and 26 years of age. Her oldest three children are married, two of them live independently and one married daughter lives in her home and shares the household expenses with her parents. Her youngest son works as a security guard and also helps to support the household. Her husband helps her with the business selling merchandise. With a lot of effort, the couple has managed to build their own home. With this loan she will buy jackets, pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, dresses, etc. in order to have a sufficient inventory of clothing for her demanding customers. Her goal is to increase her business with more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy jackets, pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 38 años, por lo que su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Esta Joven tiene 3 hijos todos están a su cargo. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse el pan de cada día de la manera más humilde, por lo que está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar productos como calzado, sabanas, toallas, perfumes cremas y colonias ya que se acerca el día de la Madre  y tiene bastantes pedidos. Sueña con mejorar cada día su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old and her activity is selling general merchandise. This young woman is raising 3 children. She has been in this business for more than six years, and she has always liked to work and earn her daily bread in the most humble way. She is asking for this financing for working capital and to buy products such as footwear, sheets, towels, perfumes, creams, and colognes, since Mother's Day is coming up and she has a lot of orders. Her dream is to improve her housing day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Carmina

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Rosa Carmina I. le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su casa.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora, porque le preocupa la seguridad de su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como encargada de un centro comercial.
texts.en:
Rosa Carmina house is lacking a fence around its border. She is asking for the loan to buy materials and to pay the person who will make the improvement. She doesn't have the money for the improvement, and she is worried about her family's safety. She plans on paying off the loan with the income she receives from her job at a shopping mall.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make a fence around her house.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica  tiene 27 años,  vive con su esposo y su hijo en una cA. alquilada. Hace mas de 4 años se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales al por mayor, en su mayoría filtrantes y sustancias digestivas. Siendo estas repartidas a diversas zonas de los pueblos rurales cercanos a su localidad, en donde su esposo la ayuda en el transporte de su mercadería. Para  que sus ventas sean exitosas, expone las bondades y características de sus productos, eso le da más ventaja lo cual le genera más ganancias, por tal motivo se proyecta y desea implementar de más productos y aumentar su capital de trabajo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y asegura cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, además considera que este aporte le será de mucho beneficio e importancia para mejorar su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
Yessica is 27 and lives with her husband and child in a rented house. For over 4 years she has sold natural medicines at wholesale prices, mainly detox remedies and digestive aids. She sells in various rural villages near her home, and her husband helps her to transport the merchandise. In order for her sales to be successful, she explains the benefits and characteristics of her products. This gives her an advantage and makes her good profits. Thus, she plans to stock up on more products and increase her working capital. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she will repay it on time. She knows that this loan will be very beneficial and instrumental in the betterment of her business. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of natural medicines.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural medicines

loans.name: Gerardo De Jesus

texts.es: Gerardo De Jesús tiene 40 años, su actividad es un comedor. Hace más de 9 años que lo tiene, el local se encuentra en un punto en donde es transitado por muchos clientes pues él lo inicio con su compañera de vida con el objetivo de buscar ingresos para su hogar, por lo que tiene 3 hijos a su cargo el se levanta muy temprano para realizar las compras de los granos básicos,  azúcar, aceite, frutas, verduras y bolsas plásticas. El financiamiento es para comprar materia prima. El sueño de Gerardo es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gerardo De Jesús is 40 years old and his activity is a restaurant. He has had it for more than 9 years. The locale is in a place with a lot of customer traffic. He started it with his life's companion with the goal of seeking income for his home where he is raising 3 children. He gets up very early to make the purchases of basic grains, sugar, oil, fruit, vegetables, and plastic bags. The financing is to buy raw materials. Gerardo's dream is to grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luís R. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo comprar mercancía para el negocio. 
Esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para poder comprar una maquina mas moderna para revisión de los diagnósticos de los carros que tiene para repararlos, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que es la fuente de ingreso de su familia.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Santa Álvarez esposa del señor José Luís R..
texts.en:
José Luís R. is grateful for your cooperation with the previous loan. He was able to buy merchandise for his business with the loan. He is asking for a new loan to be able to buy a more modern machine. The machine is to perform diagnostic checks on the cars that he has to repair. At this time he does not have the money for this, and he does not want to take money out of the business. He plans to pay the loan with part of his earnings from the business. The business is the source of income for the family. The person appearing in the photo is Santa Álvarez, José Luís R.’s wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a more modern diagnostic machine

loans.name: Yojana

texts.es: Yojana tiene  24 años, vive  con su madre y su hijo en casa de un familiar. Hace mas de 10 años vende granos, como: maíz, quinua, cebada y éstos son adquiridos al por mayor para luego ser vendidos en ferias comerciales de su localidad, así como de otros lugares aledaños a su zona. Paralelo a ello, se dedica a la crianza de cerdo y vaca, que son comercializados luego de varios meses de alimentación para así ofrecerlo a un precio mayor del inicial. Su madre siempre la acompaña en realizar esta tarea, de esa manera logra conseguir el sustento económico. Eligió vender granos, debido a que sus compradores pagan un buen precio  por cada kilo que vende y eso le  trae buenas ganancias por lo que quiere comercializar en mayor cantidad. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte de su grupo comunal, se compromete a ser muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de granos para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Yojana is 24 and lives with her mother and child in the house of a family member. For 10 years she has sold grains, such as corn, quinoa and barley which she buys wholesale and sells in local commercial markets and other nearby locations. She also raises pigs and cows, which she buys and then sells at higher prices after feeding them for several months. Her mother always helps her with this work; this is how they sustain themselves economically. Yojana chose to sell grains because her customers pay a good price for every kilo she sells, and this gives her a good income to invest in more stock. This is her first loan with MFP; she was invited to become part of her community group. She promises to be very responsible with her repayments, and thanks those who support her loan. It will be very helpful in the growth of her business. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of more grains to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of grains

loans.name: Bulmaro

texts.es:
El señor Bulmaro C. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos de pequeña edades.
Solicitan un préstamo para realizar un gasto medico de una familiar ya que lo quieren ayudar, pero no cuenta con el dinero que necesita para realizarse unos estudios médicos.
Don Bulmaro C. trabaja en una joyería en el área de reparación y elaboración de joyería de oro y planta. Con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su empleo planea pagar el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Bulmaro C. has two small children. They are asking for a loan for medical expense for a relative they want to help. But, he does not have the money he needs to do some medical tests. Bulmaro C. works in a jewelry store. He works on repairs and making gold and silver jewelry. He plans to repay the loan with part of the income he gets from his job since this is his family's source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es: Cristina del Carmen G. de 31 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Apopa, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposo y sus tres hijos de 11, 8 y 3 años de edad, de los cuales los dos mayores estudian y el menor se queda en casa junto a ella. Cristina posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos varios como alimentos, golosinas, bebidas, cremas para el cuerpo y rostro, papel para regalo y otros más, su negocio tiene varios años de funcionar y esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Debido a que cuenta con mucha competencia en los alrededores, ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su negocio comprando productos en cantidades más grandes, y así mismo haciendo énfasis en las cantidades de aquellos productos que más se venden como la leche, los huevos y el pan, de igual modo incluir otros nuevos como medicinas y productos que han sido lanzados al mercado recientemente. El mayor anhelo de Cristina es el de poder ver crecer su negocio y llegar a poseer una de las tiendas más fuertes del lugar, por medio de la cual pueda obtener mayores ganancias y pueda tener una vida mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina del Carmen G. is 31 years old, and she lives in the Apopa municipality. She lives with her family, which is comprised of her husband and their three children. The children are 11, 8, and 3 years old. The two oldest go to school, and the youngest one stays at home with her. Cristina has a store where she sells various products like food, sweets, drinks, face and body cream, wrapping paper, and other items. She has had the business for several years, and it is located in her house. She is requesting a loan because there is a lot of competition around. That way she will be able to stock her business by purchasing larger quantities of products. At the same time she will emphasize the products that sell the most like milk, eggs, and bread. She will include new things like medicines and products that have recently come on the market. Cristina’s greatest desire is to be able to see her business grow. She wants to have one of the strongest stores in the area. That way she can get greater income, and she will be able to have a better life with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita A. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 60 years old. Pablita is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Pablita owns & operates a business venture selling specialty food products in the local community. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pablita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Pablita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Pablita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Pablita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Un Pan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. KO. Un P. is the village bank president, selected by all sixteen members of the group loan in Prey Lvea Kaeut village in Takeo province. Each member of the bank loan will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. KO. Un P. sells vegetables and fruits at the local market to earn some money to support her family. She is a widow with two children who attend school in the local village. Although she works hard at her business, she earns little income. To improve her family's living conditions, she wants to start a new business but does not have enough money. Therefore, Mrs. KO. Un P. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes A. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Lourdes is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling sweets & confectioneries such as cookies & cakes in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she has for sale. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza S., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married and blessed with a child, she makes sure that she earns well so that her family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Flordeliza has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues. She uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries needed to replenish and maintain operations of her variety store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her child’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying groceries needed to replenish and maintain operations of her variety store.

loans.name: Pheang's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of  four people living in Prey Chambak village in Takeo province. They will each use their share of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. All the members have  selected Miss Pheang T. as group leader. She was born in 1968. She is a weaver and a silk cloth seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Miss Pheang T. is applying for a loan to buy more silk cloth to resell. She is single and lives with members of her household.

loans.use: To buy more silk cloth to resell

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy K. is a 28 year old married woman who lives in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two hectare of land to cultivate rice.  She also breeds pigs for selling to support her family. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. They have three children; two attend school and the youngest is a one year old. Chanthy decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.  Her husband is pictured with her.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, pesticide.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth L., 45, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Ramon L., an assistant manager, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own salon for quite some time now.

Elizabeth has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her salon business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 44,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying equipment and expanding her salon business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for education for her children.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying equipment and expanding her salon business.

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en: Keo K. is the leaders of a three person group located in Trapeang Roka village, in Takeo province. They will use their share of the loan for different purposes.  Keo K. has two children, one of whom is a laborer and the other helps out at the family farm.  Keo and her husband own two hectare of land to grow crops.  They also breed and sell pigs.  Keo is asking for a loan to hire laborers to harvest sesame.

loans.use: Hire farming laborers to harvest sesame.

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy O. is 38 years old and the leader of group loan located in Ampil Kaeut village, in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice.  Beside farming, Kuy is a pig breeder and her husband is a rice middleman who owns a rice mill to support their family. 

Kuy decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for pig breeding and more rice to support her husband's business. This couple has a child who is a silk weaver at home.  Kong Toun, Pang Kimheng, and Chreang Kim are the guarantor of this group loan.

loans.use: Buy pig food and rice.

loans.name: Vin's Group

texts.en:
In Kor village, in Takeo province, consists four people who make up a group loan.  Vin V. is the group leader, selected by the others members.  Each will use their share of the loan to improve their businesses. 

Vin is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate and sell rice, to support her family.  Her husband is a blacksmith who earns a small salary.  So to improve her family's living conditions, Vin is requesting a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding, to start a new business.  She and her husband support three children; one is enrolled in local public school and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Sokhon S. is a 28 year old married woman who lives in Krang Thnong village, in Takeo province. She and her husband, Chantha, own and farm two hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living.  Sokhon is asking for a loan to buy rice seeds.  Aside from family farming, her husband is also a farm laborer and this helps to support his family. This couple has two young pre-school age children.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak E. is 36 years old man who lives in Choes village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Sophea, are farmers.  They own 1.50-hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living.  Aside from farmer, Sophea is also a tailor to earn more income to support her family. 

Sopheak decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support his farm crops and a sewing machine to support his wife's business. 

This couple has two children; one attends the local school and the youngest is three years old.  His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and sewing machine.

loans.name: Sao Dy

texts.en: Sao Dy S., 44, lives in Tralach village, in Takeo province.  She is a farmer who owns two hectare of land to cultivate rice.  Aside from farmer she is also a pig breeder.  Sao Dy decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to support her farm and to buy pig food for pig breeding.  Her husband, Sophal, is a tax officer. This couple has four children; who all are students who support their mother's businesses.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, rice seeds ans pig food.

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en:
Sat M. is 41 years old and the leader of this group loan, located in Thnal Louk village in Takeo province.  All the members will use their share of the loan for different purposes.  Sat is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares of land to cultivate and sell rice to support her family.  She is also a farm laborer. 

Her obstacle is that her field has infertile soil.  To improve production Sat is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.  Her husband is a fisherman. She is a mother of three children, two attend a local public school and the youngest one is three years old.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Sarin M. is a 26 year old married woman who lives in Trapeang Khnaor village, in Takeo province.  She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  Her husband is a construction worker. In order to increase their income to improve their family living, Sarin decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow and 150 chickens for breeding. They have two children; one is attending the local school while the youngest is 2 years old.  Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: Buy a cow and 150 chickens.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un M. is 56 years old and she lives in Samna Khmau village, in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own three hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living.  Aside from farming they also make and sell thatch to support their family.  Un is requesting a loan to add to her saving to purchase a motorbike.  This couple has five children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory another is a construction worker and the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna U. is from the village of San Roque, Valencia City. She is 34 years old. Edna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Edna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Houn's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Houn H., the group leader of this bank loan, was selected by the four members living in Chiev Bdei Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. Each of the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. Houn H. is a farmer who owns over two hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. He is also a farm laborer. His problem is that his rice field is infertile and far from an irrigation system. To improve production, Mr. Houn H. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline and to rent machines to plow his field. His wife, Mrs. Vaney Chheng, is a Khmer cake maker. Mr. Houn H. is the father of three children who are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline and to rent plowing machines

loans.name: Mrs. Sarem Chuong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine people who live in Sla village in Takeo province. They will each use their share of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in the future.

Mrs. Sarem C. is the village bank president selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family; she is also a farm laborer. Her husband is a bed maker who earns some money to support his family. Mrs. Sarem C.'s problem is that she does not have a motorbike for transportation. To improve her farming conditions, Mrs. Sarem C. is seeking a loan to buy a new motorbike. She is the mother of two children who are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en: Sorm S., 55, sells clothes and shoes in the local market of Kampong Chhnang province. She is a widow with four children. Two of her children are in school and two are employed. She typically makes about US$6 each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for US$400 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon S., 55, is married and lives with six of her children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$1 each day and are supported by three children working in the garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Nuon S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer and also to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to operate a moto-taxi. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for farming and a moto-taxi to operate as a business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline U. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Evangeline is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Aside from selling snack foods, another source of income for the family comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie B. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Melanie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melanie makes and sells food. The main source of income for her business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Mrs. Vannak C., 29, (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Yem, 28, have been married for five years and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young. The family lives along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Vannak has been a tailor since 1998 and runs a tailoring shop at her home. Her husband is a farmer. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorized hand tiller for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller for her husband

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soun M. is pictured with her husband. The couple have been married since 1962 and have six children: five sons and one daughter. Three of them married; two live outside the family home. One son is a garment factory worker, another one is a clerk; and another one assists his parents in the business. The family lives a small village along National Road Number Two about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Soun and her husband have been selling small trees for ten years. Their son who is a garment factory does not have his own motorcycle to get work. So Soun is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for her son.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to work

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng Y., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two young children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of about USD $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD $5 per day.

Y. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to support the children’s study. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon C., 38, is a professional basket weaver, making US $1 each day in the Kampong Chhnang province. She is married and has three children. Her husband, Meach Norng, makes approximately US $2.50 every day as a construction foreman.

Chuon C. would like a loan of US $800 to finish her construction.

loans.use: To finish construction

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
Perfecta U. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Perfecta is widowed and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Perfecta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Perfecta has been engaged in her business for less than a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Perfecta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perfecta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Perfecta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Perfecta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Melagresa

texts.en:
Melagresa T. is from the village of Magsaysay Gingoog City. She is 49 years old. Melagresa is single. To make a living, Melagresa owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling of Avon products in the local community. Melagresa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melagresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melagresa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melagresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas P., 24, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

P. sells groceries and grows rice for an income of about USD $2 per day. Her husband is employed in a private company in the city, earning an income of USD $6 per day.

P. is requesting a loan of USD $1200 to purchase wood to repair the grocery store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to support her child’s study. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair the grocery store

loans.name: Jonervin

texts.en:
Jonervin A. is from the village of Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela. He is 25 years old and married. Jonervin owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jonervin has been involved in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Jonervin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonervin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. Jonervin is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Jonervin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem Y., 35, is married and lives with her five children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She sells dry fish and firewood, making approximately US $3 each day, and her husband stays at home helping her selling dry fish and wood. Her family is also supported by her child’s US $2 income each day.

Rem Y. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi. She believes that this purchase will allow her to increase her income and be able to better support her large family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina  A. is 54 years old and married. She has 8 children, ages 15 - 31.  She owns a business where she sells ice-cakes: flavored ice in styrofoam cups.  Lina has 3 years of experience in this business.  Lina  needs a loan of WST $2450 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Lina  joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan from SPBD. SPBD loans are Lina 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Mrs. Thy Nov Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Ba Srae village in the Takeo province, 19 people joined for a village-bank loan. Mrs. Thy N. is the village-bank president who was selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Thy N. is 40 years old. She is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband Mr. Phoeurn Oreing is a fisherman. Her problem is that her husband’s fishing supply is not enough to use. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Thy N. is seeking a loan to buy fishing net and a fishing boat. She is the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and fishing boat

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen S., 31, is married with three young children living at home in the Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband are garment factories workers, typically making US $2 each per day.

Pen S. would like a loan of US $200 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will reduce her transportation cost and allow her family save more than before.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren C., 40, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

She sells Chinese noodle for an income of about USD $10 per day. Her husband is employed as a gardener, earning an income of USD $6 per day. C. also helps her husband in gardening.

C. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached for her husband to provide transportation services. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached

loans.name: Faauu

texts.en:
Faauu Matini is 32 and married with 5 children (ages 3 - 17).  She is starting a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Faauu needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or about US$188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Faauu joined SPBD this year.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faauu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Palolo

texts.en:
Palolo T. is 37 years old and married. She has 6 children, ages 13 - 25.  She owns a business catching and selling farm-raised fish. Palolo has 3 years of experience in this business.  Palolo needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve her house.

In 2006, Palolo joined SPBD. This is her 4th loan from SPBD. SPBD's loans are Palolo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela. She is 25 years old, married and has 2 very young children. Erlinda owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for fattening and sale. Erlinda has been involved in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP monthly whenever she sells a raised animal.

In 2008, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad S. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Natividad is married. To make a living, Natividad owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. She also cooks snack foods like "binignit," a kind of porridge mixed with different kind of root crops like sweet potatoes, ube, and banana. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.
